loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Mrs. Hay is a mother of two young children and lives together with her husband in Prey Chor district. She is now 29 years old and is in the business of cultivating rice crops for a living. She is able to grow her rice plants twice a year as the river flows through her village and she gets enough water from it. 

She generally earns an average of $1.50 per day through her activities. This year Mrs. Hay plans to expand her farmland and increase her rice production. However, due to the lack of capital, Mrs. Hay wasn't able to buy a piece of farmland from her neighbor. For this reason, she has asked HKL for funds so she can purchase the land and expand her farm. 

She hopes to grow her farming business gradually.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland.

Eden has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for copra. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Eden has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Eden hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Having joined HSPFI this year, she is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more rice, coconuts and bananas to sell. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is recognized as a jolly and hard-working woman. She is married to Alejandro and has three children. She has been involved in buying and selling hogs for 10 years and has extensive experience in this business.

Marivic is thankful for having other sources of income aside from hog-raising. She has also run her retailing business for two years. Marivic dreams of lifting her family out of poverty; that’s why she works hard through her businesses.

Marivic wants to provide the necessities for her pigs; therefore, she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and yield higher prices when it is time for them to be sold. She also hopes to grow her business to secure a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is from the village of San Juan. She is 47 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. Amelita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately P4,000 a month from it.

Amelita is asking for a loan to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Amelita is requesting a new loan of P25,000 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, spices, drinks, and snack foods.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, spices, drinks, and snack foods for her store.

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en:
Altansuvd, 42, owns a small hotel locates in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She has been in business for less than one year. 

Altansuvd is a doctor who works as a family physician in the hospital in Kherlen, a western boundary town of Mongolia.

She is planning to renovate the rooms in her hotel to improve service and quality.  Her hotel has 10 rooms and its capacity is 20-25 guests per day.  On average, the daily per room cost is $15.  This is considered a very lower price.  

According her plan, Altansuvd can increase her room price by 5%-10%.  The loan will be dedicated to making renovations to her hotel rooms.

loans.use: to making renovations to her hotel rooms.

loans.name: Phang

texts.en:
Phang is 56 years old and his wife, Soum, is 53 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for nearly 10 years and have one son who is in school.  

Phang and his wife are farmers; they grow beans and cauliflower on their farmland in the village where they live. Additionally, Phang’s wife also buys fish from fisherman in her village and carries them by bicycle to sell at the local market. 

Phang is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his farm.

Note: In the photo, Phang and Soum are at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is  47 years old, married, and has five children. Her ambition is to improve her hog-raising business to support her family and to continue sending her children to school. She has been in this business for almost 26 years earning profits of PHP 2,500 per piglet that she uses for their basic necessities and to finance the education of her children. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, she has the strong determination to uplift her standard of living and to give her children a good life.

Her goal is to raise more pigs to increase her income. Thus, Virginia is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hog-raising business. She believes that this loan will contribute a lot to making the business grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Kosal is 30 years old, while her husband, Oun, is 48 years old. They live in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have two young children, one son and one daughter. 

Kosal and her husband are rice farmers. Additionally, Kosal’s husband also sells cows. He buys cows from the nearby districts and resells them to a middleman who comes to buy them at his home.  

Kosal is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to help raise capital for her husband to buy additional cows for resale.

Note: In the photo, Kosal is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to help raise capital for her husband to buy additional cows for resale.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, age 36, is a soldier and his wife, Sarom, age 34, is a garment worker. They have been married since 1993 and have five daughters who are in school. The family is living in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Sothea is asking for a loan in the amount of $800 to buy a motorbike for his daughters to drive to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his daughters to drive to school.

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Sivorn, age 31, is a widow with two children -- one son and one daughter. One is in school and another one is still young. She also has one niece and one nephew who are living with her. They live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sivorn is a garment worker. Additionally, she is also a rice farmer. 

Sivorn is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 in order to purchase a motorcycle for her niece, who is a garment worker, so she can drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her niece, who is a garment worker, so she can drive to work.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is a garment worker while her husband, Sopheng, is a construction worker. They have been married for five years and have one young daughter. They live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sophorn is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is a loving father and husband. He has been involved in farming for 10 years. He is 30 years old and raising four children and tries to work hard to provide the best conditions for his family. He is now requesting a loan for P25,000 to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in preparing his farm. He hopes to obtain plentiful crops in the harvest season in order to save for the education of his children, as well as to secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in preparing his farm

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chanthan pictured here) is 31 years old and his wife, Sarim, is 30 years old. They have been married for eight years and have two young children, one son and one daughter. The family is living in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Chanthan is a chef; he cooks for wedding parties and other occasions. He also drives a motor taxi when he is free. His wife is a garment worker. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to assist in his parents’ business making prahoc (a popular Cambodian condiment made of fermented fish paste and salt). Chantha’s parents will use the loan to buy small fish and other ingredients to make prahoc.

loans.use: To help his parents buy small fish and other ingredients to make prahoc.

loans.name: Amgalanbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Amgalanbaatar, age 37, runs a taxi service around the districts of Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been running his business for two years. His daily earnings do not always pay for his family's necessities. 

He lives with wife and son in their house, which was built in the early 1980s. His family has been living in this house since it was built, and they have never made any improvements to it.
  
Lately his house has become very uncomfortable. It has become cold during winter and many parts are damaged. Therefore, Amgalanbaatar decided to make renovations to his house and he needs to purchase the necessary building materials to make these renovations. Then he will install a smokeless furnace in his living room. 

In the last several years, smoke and air pollution have become big issues in Mongolia. It comes from the slum district households that use coal and old cars in the cities. 

The loan Mr. Amgalanbaata is requesting will be dedicated to making renovations to his house and to buying a new smokeless furnace from a certified supplier.

loans.use: to make renovations to his house and to buy a new smokeless furnace from a certified supplier.

loans.name: Jovit

texts.en:
Jovit is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Jovit has a shop that sells used clothing such as shirts and blouses. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy a stock of used clothing.

Jovit has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovit hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao is a weaver and also assists her husband’s pig farming businesses and rice wine production. They have been married since 1987 and have two sons and two daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home. One is a weaver and the other two attend school. The family is living in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Nao is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase pig feed and additional pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru: Чахонгир проживает в районе Пяндж. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается скотоводством. Чахонгир разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота и минеральных удобрений. У него при доме имеется небольшой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи.
texts.en: Jahongir lives in the Pyandj region. He is 28 years old, married, and has three children. He is engaged in livestock breeding. He raises cattle for sale. He needs a loan to buy small cattle and mineral fertilizer. Next to his house he has a small plot of land where he grows vegetables.

loans.use: to buy small cattle and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sok Heng

texts.en:
Sok Heng is 32-year-old widower. He lives with his mother in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Sok Heng is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. His old motorbike breaks down often, and he spends a lot of money repairing it. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 USD to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy new motorcycle.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sum appears in the photo with her one daughter in front of her thatched house in the Prey Chor district. She has a common-law relationship with her husband who works as a rice farmer as well as a sugar-palm tree climber. After her husband gets palm juice from the top of the tree, he brings it to his wife at home. Then Mrs. Sum starts burning palm juice until palm sugar is made. 

Mrs. Sum typically yields a profit of $2.50 per day from this business. Mrs. Sum has a lot of customers who come to buy her palm sugar, and she wants to improve this business by increasing her volume.

In order to achieve her goal, she is asking for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 from HKL and Kiva to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to travel far distances to collect as much palm juice as he can. Mrs. Sum hopes that she will be able to lift her family out of poverty as she and her husband strive to work.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to travel far distances to collect as much palm juice as he can.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of supplements for his business.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Kea is 39 years old, while her husband, Sorn is 42 years old.  They live in suburb of Phnom Penh, about 25 kilometers outside the city center.  They have been married since 1991.  They have 5 children - 3 sons and 2 daughters.  One is a teacher and others attend school. 

Kea and her husband are farmers. Kea’s husband also does construction work to earn extra income.  In the photo, Kea is at home, not at the farm.  

Kea is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorcycle.  The motorcycle will be used by her daughter who is a teacher, so that she can travel to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to school.

loans.name: Gazelle

texts.en:
Gazelle is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Gazelle has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses and bed sheets. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Gazelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gazelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется торговая точка, где он в основном продает женское и мужское нижнее белье, а также и детскую одежду. В этой области он два года. Ему 23 года. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Murodali is engaged in sales in a market.  He has a shop where he sells mostly men and ladies underwear as well as children's clothes.  He has been in the business for 2 years.  He is a single 23-year-old man.  He lives with his parents.  He is taking out a loan to buy the seasonal clothes.

loans.use: To buy children's winter clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods. snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Hawanatu. She is married, and has three children, age 5, 8 and 15 years. 

In 2002, Hawanatu established her used bras, briefs and head dresses business. She began her business to assist her husband who is also in a similar business. She transacts business with women, selecting different types of women's wear. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 1,600,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of  5,000,000 SLL. 

Hawanatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan. Now she requires a new loan in order to buy more bras, briefs and head dresses for her business. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. 

In the future, Hawanatu plans to expand her business to the other areas in the town and support her husband build a dwelling house for their family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bras, briefs and head dresses for her business.

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children.
 
Louie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Louie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Louie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nurjan

texts.ru: Нуржан 27 лет, замужем, воспитывает двоих детей двух и трех лет. Нуржан работает учителем английского языка  в сельской школе. К сожалению, заработная плата учителя не позволяет Нуржан покрыть все расходы своей семьи и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода, ее семья занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Нуржан насчитывает одну корову, одну лошадь, два теленка и десять баранов, а  также она возделывает  1,20 га земли, выращивая картофель и фасоль. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Нуржан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых овцематок. Доходы от кредита Нуржан планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en:
Nurjan is a 27-year-old married woman with two children, aged 2 and 3.  She works as an English language teacher at a village school.  Unfortunately, her teaching salary does not allow Nurjan to cover all of her family's expenses.  Livestock breeding and crop-farming are an additional source of income for Nurjan and her family.  As of today, there are one cow, one horse, two calves and ten sheep on Nurjan's farm.  She also cultivates 1.20 ha of land where she grows potatoes and beans.  

In order to further increase the livestock numbers, Nurjan sought help from Bai Tushum & Partners and asked for a loan in the amount of KGS 70000 to purchase pure-bred ewes.  Nurjan is planning on investing the earnings from the loan into the livestock, which will allow her to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino is 53 and has two school-aged children. He aims to uplift their status of living to escape poverty. To this end, he is engaged in selling ukay-ukay (used clothes) while his wife manages their small eatery. He has been in this business for almost one year and six months and has used his profits of 10,000 PHP a month to acquire his family's necessities and finance the education of their children.

He aims to strengthen his business and make it a viable source of income. Due to inadequate capital, he wants to ask for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of ukay-ukay (used clothes) for sale in the market. He believes that through his patience and sacrifices, he will improve his business and achieve his goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ukay-ukay (used clothes) for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Samuel.  He is married, and has five children, age 22, 19, 16, 11 and 9 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he is his relative and is going to school.  

In 2003, Samuel established his food business. He began his business because he wants to develop his family. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about 1,800,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Samuel requires the new loan in order to buy groundnut, pepper and Maggi (a flavor enhancer) by bags for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL.

In the future, Samuel plans to educate his children to university level and build a big store. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy pepper, Maggi and groundnuts for his business.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Мархамат женщина 48 лет, мать двоих детей, которая сама поставила детей на ноги и выдала замуж дочь. Сын работает на рынке охранником, его заработная ежемесячная плата составляет всего 300 сомони, что не хватает ему и матери на жизнь. Поэтому Мархамат работает техничкой в торговом офисе и её зарплата составляет 250 сомони. Но по ежемесячным доходам данной семьи видно, что они не в силах начать ремонт квартиры, поэтому на запрашиваемый кредит Мархамат хочет отремонтировать свою кухню, и каждый месяц со своих доходов своевременно погашать кредит. Она благодарна организации за такую возможность решения её семейных проблем.
texts.en: Marhamat is a 48 year-old woman and a mother of two children, whom she raised on her own and married off her daughter.  Marhamat's son works as a security guard at a market, and his monthly income is only 300 somoni, which is not enough to cover living expenses for himself and his mother.  This is why Marhamat works as a janitor at a sales office, and her income is 250 somoni.  But it is clear from this family's monthly income that the family is unable to start repairs of their apartment, and this is why Marhamat wants to use this loan to make repairs to her kitchen and use her income to gradually repay the loan on a monthly basis.  She is grateful to the organization for this opportunity to solve her family problems.

loans.use: to make repairs to her kitchen

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри женщина 52 лет, замужем мать четверых детей. Уже несколько лет занимается завозом и продажей материей. В бизнесе ей помогает её дочь. Мехри кроме своего бизнеса занимается шитьём женских платьев, поэтому вместо нее на месте деятельности часто сидит её старшая дочь. Сейчас уже стало достаточно холодно, поэтому большой спрос на зимние, теплые виды тканей. На получаемый кредит она планирует съездить за зимним ассортиментом материй. У неё свои постоянные клиенты, поэтому постоянно кипит торговля.
texts.en: Mehri is a 52 year-old married woman and a mother of four children.  She has been involved in delivering and selling fabrics for several years.  Her daughter helps her with the business.  Besides this business, Mehri is also involved in sewing women's dresses, which is the reason why her oldest daughter often sits at the retail outlet.  It has gotten quite cold now, causing a high demand for winter, warm types of fabrics.  Mehri wants to use this loan to bring in a winter selection of fabrics.  She has regular customers, and hence, her sales volume is always high.

loans.use: to purchase a winter selection of fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline to run the service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Saidu. He is married and has four children aged 12, 8, 6 and 5 years old. He has two additional dependents who live with him – they are the son and daughter of his sister and go to school while their parents are living in a village. 
In 2010, Saidu established a provisions and toiletries business. He began his business because he needed a means of livelihood. Working seven days a week and 17 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. Saidu has already received and successfully repaid his first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy scented soap, Omela milk, Vinnic batteries, toothpaste, biscuits and sardines for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Saidu plans to build a house and send his children to a very good private school. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Omela milk, toothpaste, biscuits, batteries, scented soap and sardines for his business.

loans.name: Muhiddinhuja

texts.ru: Мухиддинходжа парень 24 лет, холостой, самостоятельный бизнесмен. Он занимается продажей мужской одежды и обуви. Получает у нас кредиты с 2007 года. За товаром ездит в Бишкек сам один раз в месяц. Раньше он продавал только мужскую обувь и постепенно он расширил и добавил ассортимент мужскую одежду. Его точка находится на вещевом рынке города. Планирует привезти на очередной кредит партию тёплых мужских сорочек. Он искренне благодарен за доверие и поддержку организации.
texts.en: Muhiddinhuja is a 24 year-old young, single man, who is an independent businessman.  He is involved in selling men's clothing and shoes.  He has been obtaining loans from us since 2007.  Muhiddinhuja travels for his merchandise himself to Bishkek once per month.  He previously sold only men's shoes and then gradually added men's clothing to his goods selection.  His retail outlet is located at the city's clothing market.  Muhiddinhuja plans to use this loan to bring in an inventory of men's warm shirts.  He is genuinely grateful for the organization's trust and support.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of men's warm shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана – предпринимательница, торгующая женской обувью.  В 2004 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Светлана начала свой бизнес , арендовав торговое место на центральном рынке. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Светлана сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  20,000 сом (KGS). Хороший ассортимент товара Светланы, приветливое обслуживание, практичные советы при подборе обуви привлекают  все больше и больше клиенток. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Светлана обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение зимнего  ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Светлана планирует вложить в покупку машины для транспортировки.
texts.en:
Svetlana is an entrepreneur selling women's footwear. In 2004, while searching for a source of income for her family, Svetlana started her business, renting a retail space in the central market. Through perseverance and dedicated work Svetlana was able to grow her business to a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). A good assortment of Svetlana's merchandise, friendly service, and practical advice in the selection of shoes attract more and more customers. 

In order to further develop her business, Svetlana contacted Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to expand her range of winter goods. Svetlana plans to use the profits from this loan to purchase a vehicle for transportation.

loans.use: to expand her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер – парень 27 лет, женат, живёт вместе с родителями в двухкомнатной квартире. Работает мастером-отделочником по ремонту квартир. Он сам содержит своих родителей, т.к. они у него пенсионеры. На данный кредит Алишер хочет купить цветной плазменный телевизор. Он хочет сделать родителям сюрприз на Новый год. Узнав от друзей, что возможно взяв потребительский кредит и купить телевизор, он решительно захотел купить его.
texts.en: Alisher is 27 year-old young man, who lives with his parents in a two-bedroom apartment.  He works as an interior decorator, specializing in apartment repairs.  He supports his parents himself because they are retirees.  Alisher wants to use this loan to purchase a color plasma television.  He wants to surprise his parents for the New Year's.  Having learned from friends that it was possible to obtain a consumer loan and purchase a television, he was determined to purchase it.

loans.use: to purchase a color plasma television

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: Мутабар 45 лет, она мать четверых детей. Мутабар занимается торговлей детской одеждой. За товаром ездит сама в Истаравшан и Бишкек, Кыргызстан. Каждый кредит использует на увеличение товарооборота, чтоб получить больше прибыли, а свои доходы она тратит на улучшение социального положения семьи, на ремонт дома, на покупку техники для сына. Мутабар честная и пунктуальная женщина и благодарна кредиторам и организации за понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Mutabar is 45 years and a mother of four children.  She is involved in selling children's clothing.  She travels for merchandise herself to Istaravshan and Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan.  Mutabar uses every loan for increasing goods turnover in order to earn a bigger profit, and she spends her earnings to improve her family's welfare, repair the house and buy electronics for her son.  Mutabar is an honest and punctual woman, and she is grateful to creditors and the organization for the understanding and support.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 
Thelma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Thelma has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Irene has a shop that sells fruits such as pomelo (a native citrus fruit) and bananas. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fruit for resale.
Irene has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits for resale.

loans.name: Mahsudjon

texts.ru: Махсудчон парень 33 лет, женат имеет троих детей, жена домохозяйка. Он производит сахар-рафинад на дому. Сейчас под Новый год на рынке идет оживленная торговля. Махсудчон планирует на полученный кредит закупить партию сахара-песка, для расширения  своего производства. Кроме этого Махсудчон является также мастером по отделке квартир, в летний сезон он занимается своим любимым делом, ремонтом квартир. Имея все эти доходы Махсудчон содержит свою немаленькую семью. Можно с уверенностью сказать, что получив кредит Махсудчон увеличит производство и без проблем может оплатить взятый кредит.
texts.en: Mahsudjon is a 33 year-old young man, who is married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He produces refined sugar at home.  Sales at a market are high now, prior to the New Year's holiday.  Mahsudjon plans to use this loan to purchase an inventory of granulated sugar in order to expand his production.  Besides this business, Mahsudjon is also an apartment interior decorator and is involved in his favorite business of repairing apartments during the summer season.

loans.use: to purchase granulated sugar

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is from the village of Disimuray. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Juliana started her sari-sari store (variety store) many years ago, and she earns approximately P500 (Philippine peso). According to Juliana, through the income she generates from her sari-sari store, she is able to support her family's needs.

Juliana wants to expand her family's business, so she is taking out this P20,000 loan to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, groceries, sugar, and other basic ingredients to sell.

Juliana hopes to grow and expand her general store to secure her family's future. She hopes to educate her children so that they will become professional someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for their education.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock such as canned goods, groceries, sugar, and other basic ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline to run the service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline to run the service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Despite his young age, Alvin patiently works on his family farm to attain a better quality of life for his family. He is 18 years old and works on his farm to feed his family. He doesn’t want to see his parents working so hard just to provide their daily needs, so he decided to operate a farming business to attain this desire. 

He earned approximately PHP 15,000 last crop, and he used his income for allowances for his two school-age siblings, household expenses, and food. Because of these costly needs, he was not be able to save for his farming business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan amount PHP18,000 to purchase corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to continue his farming business. 

He hopes to further grow his business for the betterment of their life.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizer and pesticide use to continue his farming business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Nenita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Nenita has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Johny

texts.en:
Johny has been planting and harvesting rice for over 10 years.  He works untiringly in his half-hectare rice field in order to ensure a good crop yield.  He generated revenue of about 35,000 PHP from his last harvest.  Part of his income serves as capital to support his farming business and another portion of his income covers the education expenses of his three children.  

Johny would like to continue producing abundant harvests so, he is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy five sacks of fertilizer and three bags of rice seeds to grow.  He hopes that through these additional resources, he will be able to increase his crop yield and produce an abundant harvest.  He plans to save any additional revenue generated from this loan to meet his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer and three bags of rice seeds to grow.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rice farming is the primary source of income in the village where Rolando resides. He is involved in this business to earn a living. Rolando is 42 years old and married to Anabelle. His wife works abroad as a domestic helper. In the absence of his wife, he carries the burden of taking care of their two children and also doing farming activities. He plants and harvests rice to sell. 

He wants to improve his output but it requires additional capital so he is now asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy two liters of Bayluscide (molluscicide) and fertilizers to use in farming. This will ensure good growth of his crops and later on will yield more sacks of rice to sell.

Rolando aims to make his business more profitable so that he can provide for all of his family's needs and to encourage his wife to come back home and not to work abroad anymore.

loans.use: to buy two liters of Bayluscide (molluscicide) and fertilizers to use in farming.

loans.name: Ishmael

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Ishmael. He is married and has one child aged five years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him – his mother.  
In 2002, Ishmael established a DVD and VCD disc business. He began his business to provide a livelihood and because he saw it would be profitable. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. 
Ishmael would like a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid his first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy DVDs, VCDs, televisions and VCD players. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Ishmael plans to transform his small shop into a larger one, to own a house and send his child to a very good private school. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy DVDs, VCDs, televisions and VCD players.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his stock of chips and chicken

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Margarita works hard to support her family. She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog raising. Margarita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving business. 
Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving.

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok is a 24-year-old married woman with no children. She has run a food sales business in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.
Ajok has requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for resale.

loans.name: Ilyich

texts.en:
Ilyich is 29 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city with his family – his parents, wife and small daughter.
Ilyich has a passenger vehicle which he uses to carry passengers from Vanadzor to Yerevan and back. He has run this business for about three years and thus provides for his family. Ilyich’s father is also a driver; his mother and wife are unemployed. 
Ilyich says his work is very laborious, as driving many hours a day is very hard, plus the work carries a lot of responsibility as he transport people. 
Ilyich is asking for a loan of 400,000 AMD to buy winter tire casings and to do some necessary repair works on his car. This will allow him to carry his passengers safely.

loans.use: to buy winter tire casings and do some necessary repair works on his car.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe is 39 years old and an industrious father of three children. He is very enthusiastic to support his family through his farming business. With this kind of occupation, he is able to provide for his family's basic necessities, but is not be able to save for the education of his children. So, he is requesting a loan of P25,000 to purchase corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. He hopes to protect his business with his loan, earn sufficient income to educate his children, and improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Betty. She is married and has four children aged 16, 14, 11 and 5 years old. 
In 2002, Betty established a clothing business. She began her business because she was told it would be profitable and because she needed to help her husband to support their family. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, Betty earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. Betty has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy waxed cotton, lace material and knickers for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Betty plans to transform her stall into a shop and engage in international business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy waxed cotton, lace material and knickers for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 51, married and has three children – two adults and a minor who is still schooling. He lives with his family in Murang’a, Central Kenya, where he has been in active farming for over 30 years. His farm currently produces milk and vegetables for the local market. Joseph laments the high cost of feed, especially for dairy cows.
Joseph has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming in addition to his vegetable and dairy farming. He hopes his enhanced farming will increase his household income and enable him to educate his child who is still schooling.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 65-year-old businessman. He is married to Elizabeth, a businesswoman, and they are blessed with one child aged 19. Philip has been running a retail shop for the past ten years making a monthly income of 4,500 KES, which he uses to support his family.
Philip is applying for his fourth loan with Kiva partner KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. Philip will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil in preparation for the increase in purchases during the festive season. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand his business. 
Philip's hope and dream is own a wholesale shop, which will help him educate his child up to university level.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Angelitania

texts.en:
Angelitania is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Angelitania has a shop that sells fruits such as bananas and mangoes. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fruits for resale.
Angelitania has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits for resale.

loans.name: Nargila

texts.en:
Nargila is 41 years old. She is from the village of Beitarabchi, East Georgia. Nargila lives with her 21-year-old son and retired mother. Nargila and her son lead the family's agricultural business. They have a milk cow, five calves and ten sheep. The family sells dairy products and lambs on the local market. In addition, Nargila’s family owns four hectares of land where different corns and vegetables are grown, which are also sold locally. The family's total average monthly income is 600 Laris.
Nargila has requested credit for cultivating the land. After cultivation, Nargila will sow corn and vegetables. She hopes that the weather conditions will be favorable this year and she will get a good harvest, which will be sold locally. Nargila will use the extra income to finance the family’s daily living costs.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Akot

texts.en:
Akot is  40 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom attend in school. She has a food stall in Bor, South Sudan, which she has been doing for two years.

Akot is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use  to purchase beans, vegetables and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, vegetables and onions to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a farmer in Murang'a area of Central Kenya and has been in farming for  30 years. He is married and has six children, four adults and two minors. He currently employs two farmhands and produces milk, tea, and horticultural products for the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business for additional income.

Daniel is requesting a loan for 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to install an irrigation system at his farm. He will buy a water pump for 45,000 KES and irrigation pipes with the remaining 15,000 KES. He is focusing on expanding his horticultural products on his farm so that he can export his produce.

The periodic drought is Daniel's main challenge in farming in the area. He notes that Juhudi Kilimo is assisting farmers through the loan provisions.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic wants to improve her business and is asking for additional capital to provide good nutrition for her hogs. She wants to obtain a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines. This loan will help her grow her hogs and be able to sell them at a higher cost upon distribution. 

Marivic’s priority in life is to uplift her family's living conditions. She is 41 years old and is married with two children. She wants to earn steady income for her family’s needs. She described herself as a hardworking and responsible woman. She raises hogs to fatten and breed and usually sells them to butchers who come into her village. She earns about PHP 3,000 whenever she sells a raised hog.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years.

Zosima requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her abaca weaving.

In the future, Zosima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a married man, age 57, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a businessman dealing in cattle and he has been in this business for 3 years. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand for cattle, as the Christmas season is fast approaching. Nathan intends to use the loan to buy cattle to sell.

The client's personal goal is to buy a motorcycle and his business goal is to own a ranch.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Bengelita

texts.en:
Bengelita is 44 years old and married with 1 child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Bengelita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, frozen foods, rice and other miscellaneous items. 

Bengelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Goefrey is a 29-year-old, hardworking man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. The family goals are to build a permanent home, educate his children and buy a car. 

Geofrey has been selling clothes for 5 years. He started with 3,000,000 UGX, but he now has stock worth 15,000,000 UGX. His major hardships are high taxes, customers not paying on time and price fluctuations. However, he has a dream of hiring employees to help expand his business and moving his business to a more permanent location. Goefrey needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Martha. B

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Martha. She is single and has a child, age 1 year. She has 1 additional dependent that lives with her because she is her sister.  

In 2006, Martha established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed a means of getting livelihood for her family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,700,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Martha requires a loan in order to buy gara, batick and sifon clothing materials. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Martha plans to build a house and send her son to a very good school. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy gara, batick and sifon clothing materials

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en: Ignacia is 56 years old and lives in Dalisay, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married, has six children and earns a living by selling fish. She makes about PHP 5,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy more fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for the last seven years and hopes someday to be able to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is married and has for the last seven years worked hard to provide for her family by running a food vending business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make food to sell. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en: Daphine is 30 years old and lives with her child in the town of Kasese, Uganda. Her goal is to earn enough money to educate her child, and she has supported her family by running a beauty salon for the last five years. Daphne has done very well despite having to deal with problems such as inflation and frequent changes in price. She is applying for this loan to buy supplies for her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old businessman who is married to a farmer. They are blessed with three children who are ages 14, 8 and 6. John has earned about KES 10,000 a month for the past seven years by running a retail shop. He is applying for his first loan term from KADET after being introduced to our organization by a staff member. He will use this loan to buy sugar, rice and cooking oil for his shop. He will use the additional profits made possible by this loan to educate his children. His goal for the future is to buy a farm.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 36 years old, married and has one child, who is 12 years old. In 2004, she went into business by selling items for babies. Her goal was to improve her family's standard of living. She works six days a week, 10 hours a day, and earns about Le 1,200,000 a month. She is applying for a loan for Le 3,000,000 to buy baby powder, napkins and other items that mothers need to take care of their children. Her goal is to increase her profits by about Le 300,000 a month. In the future, Mamie plans to build a house and educate her child to the university level. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy baby powder, baby Johnson, napkin, and flask and mother care for her business.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is 43 years old, married and has one child.  His mother-in-law also lives with the family. He is a farmer from the village Akhasheni, Kakheti Region. Archil is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is their main source of income. They have a milk cow and sell milk on the market. They also sell grapes, harvested on family-owned one-half hectare of land. Archil grows maize on family-owned one-quarter hectare of land. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris, including the monthly pension of Archil’s mother in law. 

Archil's wife is pregnant and is expecting their second baby in December. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to cover the expenses of the maternity hospital. Archil and his wife hope that the childbirth process will be safe and both mother and the newborn will be in good health.

loans.use: to pay for the maternity hospital.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is a 49-year-old businessman who is married to Josephine, who is a farmer. They are blessed with four children aged 16, 12, 10, and 8 years respectively. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past two years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Japheth will use the loan to service his motorbike. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to start a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: to service the motorbike.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.  
  
Madina has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail.  
  
Madina has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO for 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Madina include transportation and the rainy season.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation. She also hopes to educate her children up to university.  

Madina lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity, but not piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ma.jenny

texts.en:
Ma.Jenny is 39 years old, married, and has seven children, four of whom are in school.

Ma.Jenny is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma.Jenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 22 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City. She is married and has no children. 

Evelyn has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,600 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 52 years old, widowed, and has four children.  She lives in Masindi, Uganda.  She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy salt and soap to sell. Margaret started with capital worth 200,000 shillings and now has over 5,000,000 shillings as her working capital.

Margaret hopes to educate her children and buy a car; her business goal is to diversify her income sources by buying land to grow commercial crops.

loans.use: to purchase salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Nhiel

texts.en:
Nhier is 32 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school. She sells fish in Dokuru bor, South Sudan, which she has been doing for three years.

Nhiel is requesting a loan from BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase fish. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma.chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona works hard to support her family. Ma. Chona is single and has a cheese-making business in the Philippines.

Ma. Chona requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her cheese making. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ma. Chona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her cheese making.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, aged 32, lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married with three children and runs a salon. Initially she was being employed by someone else and after saving her wages she started her own salon. She desires to educate herself and children, buy land to grow crops, and move her business to a more permanent location. Her business faces a problem of price fluctuations and unseasonable weather.

Monica wants a loan to buy cosmetics for resale and will use part of it for synthetic hair for the salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale and synthetic hair to use in the salon.

loans.name: Felna

texts.en:
Felna is 39 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods like snack foods, detergents and other groceries to sell.

Felna has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Felna aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods like snack food, detergent and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brother and sister). 

Hadjah has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products from home, retail. Hadjah has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through a rental room. 

The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation, defaulters and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale, to own a delivery van to ease transportation, and to educate her children up to university.   Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina believes that "an optimistic person will have a bright future". She is 39 years old, married, and has two school aged children. Being a responsible parent, she aims to improve the standard of living and education of her children and to give them a better life. Despite hardships and problems in life, she has the confidence to improve the business. She owns and manages a variety store while her husband works in a private institution. 

She aims to increase her product offerings in her variety store to meet her customers' demands. But due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional of P50,000 to buy additional stocks of frozen foods, diapers, detergent powders, fabric softeners, and accessories to sell in her variety store. She believes that her loan will be a big help for her to improve the business and she is hoping that someday she will expand her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods, diapers, detergent powders, fabric softener, and accessories to sell in her variety store

location.town: Brgy. San Pedro, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is 26 years old, married but not yet fortunate to be blessed with child. He is a farmer in their village who dreams to provide a comfortable life to his wife and to his future children. With his dream, he dedicates himself to operating a farming business where he plants corn and harvests to sell. Last cropping, he earned P15,000, which he spent on their household expenses such as food.

Rolly wants to further develop his business through asking for a loan amount of P25,000 to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides used in improving his farm. With his tirelessly working in the field, he knows that he can provide a comfortable life to his wife and future children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides used in improving his farm

loans.name: Abut

texts.en:
Abut is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. Two of them are in school. She has a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Abut requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is a 23-year-old single lady. She is the oldest of an 11-member family.

Ameera is a student in one of the Jordanian universities. She is majoring in social sciences, a subject at which she is very talented. Ameera wants to continue to get a Master's degree in the same major after getting her Bachelor's degree.

Now Ameera has applied for a loan to pay her semester tuition.

loans.use: to pay her semester tuition.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years of age, married, and has been blessed with two children.  They lived in the village of Disimuray in Cauayan City.  She works hard to make a living.  Gina is glad because her husband is helping her to improve their living conditions. 

Gina has been engaged in the hog-raising business, primarily for breeding, for one-year.  She patiently runs her business though periodically she has suffered some difficulties.  She endured all those hardships in her hog-raising business because she is aiming to give her family a better future and to improve their living situation.

Gina wants to improve her business which is why she is taking out this loan amounting to P5,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines to sustain her hog. This loan will help her grow her hogs and be able to sell them at a higher cost upon distribution.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines to sustain her hog.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 60-year-old business man who is married to Mary, a farmer. They are blessed with one child aged 25 years old. Michael has been running a butchery for the past twenty years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

Michael is applying for a 16,000 KES loan with KADET after repaying his two previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy a bull for slaughtering and so add stock to his business. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will work to educate his child up to university level.

Michael hopes to open a retail shop for his wife in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a bull for slaughtering for his business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 44 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Glenda works very hard to provide for them.

For the past eight years Glenda has run a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of items such as bread, sugar, beverages, soft drinks and other groceries. She is now requesting a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari.

Glenda wants to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Tashana

texts.en:
Tashana is 63 years old and married with seven children. She runs a general store in the Philippines, working hard to provide for her family. She has been running her store for five years and also earns income from vending food.

Tashana has borrowed and paid off nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Tashana aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been in active farming for over 30 years with her farm currently producing maize, beans, and  milk for the local market.She also runs a cereal retail business in the local market

Hellen has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy  poultry birds. She says she will buy poultry and venture into the poultry farming business.This is Hellen's third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo. She adds that the poultry business will improve her farming income and enable her to expand the retail cereal business to wholesale status.

Hellen is a single mother of three: two adults and a minor who is still schooling.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

Marilyn has been raising livestock  for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is acquiring a loan to service a vehicle. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is aged 41 and married with four children. Patrick started with a motorcycle for his business and after acquiring a substantial amount, he got a loan as "top up," to complete the amount he had, and bought a car.

He dreams of buying another motor vehicle so as to generate more income from his transport business.

loans.use: to service his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, a 33-year-old single lady, is living with her sisters and brothers. Her father has passed away, so Hanan had to do something in order to find a source of income for the family.

To be able to support the family and her mother, Hanan has recently started a home-based beauty salon and is still buying the required equipment, so she has applied for this loan to buy the rest of the equipment and a salon seat and more cosmetics and make-up products.

loans.use: to buy the rest of the equipment needed and a salon seat and more cosmetics and make-up products.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is from the village of Kolagi in the Gurjaani District. He is 45 years old, married, and lives with his family: his wife, Nana, their 18-year-old daughter, and 14-year-old son. The children go to school. 

Gia has a tractor. He provides tilling services to the farmers in his and nearby villages. It is the main source of income for the family. Along with the tractor, the family owns 0.1 hectare land, where peach trees grow. The family sells peaches in the local market. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Laris (GEL). 

Gia requested this loan to purchase mowing equipment, which will be fixed to the tractor. After purchasing the aforementioned equipment, Gia will provide not only tilling, but also mowing services to his client farmers. It will increase family's income. Gia plans to use the additional income to purchase additional parts for the tractor in order to diversify the services provided to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase mowing equipment.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. Melinda is married and has a firewood and charcoal retail business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store (a variety store) and motorcycle transportation business.

In the future, Melinda would like to build and expand her business to increase the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Aisha has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. Aisha sells her products from home. Aisha has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She also generates additional income through selling old shoes and Airtime. The main business challenges for Aisha include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease the difficulty of transportation. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: Top buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 48 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for her children.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in business for 10 years and sells a variety of items including snack foods, sugar, soap and other groceries.  Arlene has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

In the future Arlene would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is 38 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.  For three years, she has run a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan.

Ayen has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase beans to sell.  She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 46 years old and married with two children.  

Clarita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been in business for six years and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it.  At this time, Clarita has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 37 years old, married and has 10 children, four of whom are in school.  

Marissa is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and has been in business for seven years.  Marissa has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Saadiya

texts.en: Saadiya is a 45-year-old married woman who started a small home-based retail business five years ago, refilling and selling detergents. At first she wasn’t fully committed to the business because of some family issues, but now Saadiya wants to grow the business and work on expanding it to include food products and snacks besides the detergents. To be able to do that, she has applied for a loan to buy the products that she wants to sell and start the expansion phase.

loans.use: to buy products that she want to sell and start the expansion phase.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is 51 years old. She is a widow and lives alone in the village of Tsovagyugh in the region of Sevan as each of her four children is married and lives separately from Dilbar.

Dilbar worked milking cows for several years; but, since 1990, she has been running an agricultural business and a trading business simultaneously. Dilbar has two cows, two calves and 30 chickens and produces dairy products and eggs, which she sells from her farm.  She also sells a variety of food items and household goods from a small stall that is situated in her yard.  The income she generates from this work helps her to support herself, but she said it is not always sufficient to develop her farm and trading business. 

Dilbar is requesting a loan of 350,000 AMD to buy one more calf for her farm and to buy some foodstuffs for her stall.

This is Dilbar’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy a calf for her farm and some foodstuffs for her stall.

loans.name: Arzykan

texts.ru:
Арзыкан 60 лет, замужем, воспитала пятерых детей и является бабушкой шестерых внуков. Арзыкан на протяжении 40 лет занимается животноводством, являющийся основным источником дохода для ее семьи. Имея практический опыт в животноводстве, Арзыкан успешно развивает свое хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодня 15 овец, 5 коз, 4 коровы, 4 теленка, а также ежегодно обрабатывает 1,5 га земли. Такая деятельность позволяет Арзыкан получать около 5,000 сом в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Арзыкан  обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Арзыкан планирует вложить в реконструкцию сарая для того, чтобы улучшить условия содержания скота.
texts.en:
Arzykan is 60 years old, married, has raised 5 children and has 6 grandchildren.  Arzykan had been engaged in livestock husbandry for 40 years which has been the main source of income for her family. Having hands-on experience in livestock husbandry, Arzykan is successfully developing her business which today includes 15 sheep, 5 goats, 4 cows, and 4 calves. In addition, she is also cultivating 1.5 hectares of land.  These activities allow Arzykan to earn about 5,000 KGS per month.

In order to further expand her business, Arzykan came to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for the loan of 75,000 KGS to purchase additional livestock headcount. Arzykan is planning to invest the income from the loan into rebuilding the barn to improve living conditions of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 38-year-old mixed-crop farmer and he is married to Tabitha who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children aged fifteen and ten. He has been rearing pigs for the past six months with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Samuel will use the loan to buy pigs and pig feed. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

He hopes to open a retail shop for his wife as a secondary business to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is fifty years old and married with four children. 

Rosalina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.  Rosalina has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock.

Rosalina has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus has been in farming for six straight years in his home district of Nkubu, Central Kenya.  His farm produces bananas, beans, maize and milk, which he sells at the local market.  He runs a ballast selling business for additional income

Ephantus has requested a loan of KES 41,600 from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy and insure a dairy cow.  He says he needs to improve his farming income to enable him to educate his children as well as improve his family living standards.  He adds he needs more funds to buy more land for banana growing.

He notes, however, that poor prices for farm products is a challenge in the business, as well as insufficient rain.  He, however, remains happy with Juhudi Kilimo loan services and reveals this is his third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo after his first and second loan of KES 20,000 and KES 15,000 respectively.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is fifty-four years old and has six children.  She is a widow and has three children who are in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Grace has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Grace has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is 46 years old and married with five children who are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Darlyn has run a tailoring business in the Philippines for 17 years. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Darlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ma Elenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma Elenita works hard to support her family.

She has a jewellery (fancy earring) business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store.  Ma Elenita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more jewellery to sell.

Ma Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her previous twenty-one loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more jewellery to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cosmetics business in the Philippines. 

She will borrow PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items like body lotion, perfume and cosmetics for her cosmetics business.

Helen has been in this business for four years.  She earns most of her income from clothing sales.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, perfume and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is twenty-four years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is single. 

Rosalie has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Rosalie has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
