Florence lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.  She takes care of her additional family members (sisters) as well.  

Florence has a business of a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for ten years and she works seven days out of every week.  Florence sells her products from home, by means of retail.  

Florence has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. The main business challenge for Florence is the increasing price of cosmetics and theft.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon.  Florence lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married with eight children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Vivian is forty years old and has five children who are in school.

Vivian has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Vivian has been in this business for six years. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a thirty-four-year-old enterprising business lady.  She is married to Joseph who is a farmer.  They are blessed with two children aged seven and five years old.  She has been running a green grocer business for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Ann will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits and add more stock to her green grocery business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will rent a house to conduct her business. 

She hopes to open a retail shop which will improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more green vegetables and fruits to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is forty-two years old and a hardworking man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. His goals are to help his family by educating his children, building a permanent home, and buying a car.

Fred has been running a motorcycle transport business for two years. The hardships of this work are seasonal weather changes and taxes and other fees. Nevertheless, Fred intends to buy another motorcycle and expand his business into new markets. The purpose of the loan is to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a responsible housewife who helps her husband generate income for their family. She is 53 years old and has three adult children. She was employed as a day care teacher in their barangay, and also raises goats and ducks to sell. She aims to earn and save more income to satisfy their needs, support the education of their grandchildren and save for their future.

Due to financial constraints, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy additional goats and ducks to raise. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve her business and hopes that someday her business will become successful and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional goats and ducks to raise

loans.name: Ayuen

texts.en:
Ayuen is a 45-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Dokoru bor, South Sudan for two years.

Ayuen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for sale. In the future, she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house .

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 28-year-old lady, married with four children. Her husband sells fruit and vegetables.

Amani is working now on starting a small business at home, a home-based beauty salon. She has bought some smaller equipment and has applied for this loan to buy the rest of the tools and equipment needed to start up this business, such as cosmetics, make-up, and a skin cleaner machine.

loans.use: to start up her business by buying cosmetics, make-up, and a skin cleaner machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and cellphone accessories for retail store business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been farming for 4 years in the Kitale area of Western Kenya, where he resides with his family. He has one two year-old child. His farm currently produces maize and tomatoes, which he sells to the local market. He says one of the main challenges farmers face is disease, which eats into their income significantly. 

John has been a Juhudi Kilimo client and previously borrowed two loans of 31,200 KES and 60,000 KES. He has requested a third loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and build a poultry unit. He says the new venture will boost his farming business, providing additional farming income as well as milk for family consumption.

loans.use: to buy poultry and build a poultry unit.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Violeta is 58 years old and has one child who is in school.

Violeta has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets, paint, and other tools to repair her fishing boat.

Violeta has been in the fishing business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, paint, and other tools to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee trees and banana suckers for planting.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 24 years old, a farmer in the Philippines who is very eager to do everything just to fulfill what he had promised to his wife. He assured his wife that he would lift her up from poor living conditions into a comfortable life. So he doubles his hard work in his farming business to improve his crops. He has six years of experience in this field, and he knows that it is not an easy occupation.

But despite that, his hunger to achieve his dream inspires him to develop his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan amount P25,000 to purchase supplies such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and use them to develop his business. He hopes through these supplies he will be able to grow plenty of crops to save for the betterment of his living situation, and certainly fulfill his promise to his wife.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and use them to develop his business

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years.

Celsa requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

In the future, Celsa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Ma.fe

texts.en:
Ma.Fe is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma.Fe is 33 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 7 years.

Ma.Fe requested a 13,000  PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other tools for fishing. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other tools for fishing.

loans.name: Ma.gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari store, or convenience store, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Ma. Gina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred deals in the spare auto parts business in Masindi, Uganda. He is 49 years old and responsible for taking care of his three children. 

He had a kiosk selling fresh foods five years ago, and this acted as a stepping stone to his current business. Inadequate capital is his major challenge. He desires to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. 

Fred wants a loan to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Gilda also earns more income from videoke rentals and a general store.

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant. Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ma.nilfa

texts.en:
Ma.Nilfa is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma.Nilfa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma.Nilfa has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 37 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area, with his parents, his wife and three small children: two sons and a daughter. Artur’s parents are pensioners; his wife stays at home and takes care of their children.

For about five years Artur worked as a tunneller, but now he is engaged in farming. He has been running his farm for 11 years now, which is how he provides for his large family. On his farm Artur rears 4 cows, 4 calves and 20 chickens. Artur sells agricultural produce from his farm to his regular buyers. His wife helps him as far as possible. 

Artur is seeking a loan of 600,000 AMD to buy some sheep and two more calves for his farm. This will allow Artur to develop his farm and thus to increase his family’s income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy some sheep and two more calves for his farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. 

Mary has a business selling local medicines.  She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days a week. Mary sells her products from home, directly to her customers. Mary has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bottles of syrup and powdered medicines.  

Mary's main business challenges include the rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own permanent premises for her business. Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bottles of syrup and powdered medicines.

loans.name: Marsha

texts.en:
Marsha is 40 years old. She is married with five children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marsha has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marsha requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Marsha has been in this business for 20 years. Marsha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bull to rear.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya where he produces milk and vegetables for the local market. He has been in farming for the last four years and to generate additional income, is also employed as a motorcycle driver.

Paulo has requested funding from Juhudi Kilimo for his farming business. He wants a loan of 30,000 KES to help him buy poultry birds to expand into the poultry business. He says the additional income will enable him buy his own motorcycle and then he will not have to rely on the income he gets from being employed as a motorcycle driver. He adds that the income will improve his family's living standards.

Paulo notes that finances are hard to come by and Juhudi Kilimo loan services are very handy for farmers. He reiterates also that diseases are a great challenge in the area.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Mwamimi

texts.en:
Mwamimi is a thirty-three-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. 

He has been farming for nine years. He started as a subsistence farmer and later ventured into commercial farming and is very happy about this decision as he is reaping tangible benefits. His major hardships are inadequate capital and price fluctuations however he has a dream of expanding business into new markets. 

The purpose of this loan is to pay workers who are weeding his fields.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his fields.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 42-year-old man, married with four children. He lives in Madaba. 

Ten years ago Mohammad opened a small cafeteria that serves soft drinks and "shisha" (water pipes) and sandwiches. His cafeteria has a big base of regular customers and each day it welcomes a good number of new customers or passersby such as taxi drivers.

Now Mohammad has applied for this loan to buy a special machine that makes hot drinks (a sort of coffee maker) so he can speed up his service.

loans.use: to buy a special machine that makes hot drinks  so he can speed up his service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, aged 27, lives in Masindi, Uganda. She has three children and sells plates. 

She wishes to build a permanent home and to diversify her business. Her business faces a problem of price fluctuations. 

Beatrice wants a loan to buy plates that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy plates to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, groundnuts and rice for resale.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan wants a loan to buy new clothes to sell. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married, aged 42, and has the responsibility of taking care of her three children.

She hopes to educate her children and build a permanent home. Her business goal is to expand into new markets.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells second hand clothes at the market. She has been in this business for six years and works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges are the rainy season and the ever increasing prices of clothes in Uganda. Her goal and aspiration is to expand into a wholesale business. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to piped water or electricity. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Kuttubek

texts.ru:
Куттубек работает преподавателем химии в школе села Кара-Суу, что на севере Кыргызстана. Ему 33 года, женат и воспитывает трех детей дошкольного возраста.  
 В связи с тем, что его заработная плата не покрывала всех расходов семьи, Куттубек, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, начал заниматься разведением скота. Начав свой бизнес  со стартовой суммой 25,000 сом , Куттубек приложил все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, приносящего на сегодняшний день прибыль в 3,000 сом ежемесячно от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Куттубек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. 
В будущем, Куттубек планирует расширять поголовье скота,  с целью повышения продаж молока.
texts.en:
Kuttubek is working as a teacher of chemistry at school in the village of Kara-Suu in northern Kyrgyzstan. He is 33 years old, he is married and has three young children.

Due to the fact that his salary did not cover all expenses of the family and by searching for an additional source of income Kuttubek began to breed cattle. Starting his business with a starting amount of 25,000 KGS Kuttubek made ​​every effort to grow his business which to date brings a profit of 3,000 soms per month from the sale of meat and dairy products. For further development of his business Kuttubek has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of dairy cows.

In the future, Kuttubek plans to expand the number of livestock in order to increase sales of milk.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is a 55-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. They both work really hard to have a decent living, despite all the difficulties that they face. 

In 2000, Antoinette opened her own clothing shop. She sells good quality products at fair prices. As for her husband, he has been serving in the Lebanese army for the past five years. 

Today she’s asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional clothes for her shop so that she can earn a bigger income. In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop by adding new items to it.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina, a married mother of six children, all of whom go to school, lives in Kampala, Uganda where she takes care of two additional family members, her grand children. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Safina's monthly expenses include food and school fees.

The operator of a retail shop at the market for seven years, she works six days a week, and also sells water and boiled milk for an additional source of income. Safina has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, and flour. Her major business challenges are thieves and costly commodities. Her goal is to expand her retail shop into wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more suagr, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 19-year-old man, a freshman in one of the private colleges in Jordan. Amer is now majoring in hotel management. His course of study will take him two years to finish and graduate.

Amer has applied for a loan in order to pay his semester fees so he can start his studies and continue till graduation. He will be taking supportive courses that will help him achieve the best in the hotel management field.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 64 years old and lives in Manamong Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children.
 
Paz has a general store and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has  requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Paz has been a member of PMPC for seven years

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 41 years old.  She is married and has 7 children.   

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from a boarding house.


Juliet has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Imane

texts.en:
Imane is a 32-year-old Lebanese woman. She is living with her parents and four working siblings. Her father is the one responsible for covering the heavy life expenses.  She decided to open her own women's clothing shop in 2008, and is looking forward to further develop her work. 

Today, Imane is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new winter collection of dresses, shirts, pants and many other items.  She notes that by enlarging her shop, her sales will increase and therefore her revenues. In the future, she plans to open new branches in other areas.

loans.use: buy a collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Jessebel

texts.en:
Jessebel is 35 years old.  She is married and has one child.

Jessebel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jessebel has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell

loans.name: Aguadencia

texts.en:
Aguadencia is 61 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 3 children. 

Aguadencia has a bamboo furniture business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 to purchase bamboo materials for her bamboo furniture business. 

Aguadencia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: buy bamboo for furniture-making business

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 30 years old and single.  He is a farmer in the Philippines and has been in business for the past 10 years.  He was fortunate to earn 10,000 PHP from his last crop harvest.  He hopes to increase both his revenue and his crop yield in the future and is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

Erick said he aims to improve his family's standard of living in order to attract a wife.  He feels he is getting old to establish a family of his own and works very hard to improve his lifestyle. Through his untiring work in the field, he hopes to sufficiently improve his family's living conditions and save to establish a family of his own in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and married with 4 children.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Analyn has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Conchita

texts.en:
Ma. Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a lechon vending business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional pigs for her lechon vending business.

Ma. Conchita has been in this business for 6 years.  She also earns more income from catering food and raising pigs.

Ma. Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy pigs for her lechon business

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is 59 years old and is a widow with 8 children.

Liliosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

Liliosa has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and food vending.

Liliosa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Nabhan

texts.en: Nabhan is a 57-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife, two children who are still studying, and one child who is working. He has big responsibilities toward his family, especially his children. He has been working as a security guard in a local company for the past sixteen years. Today, he wants to borrow $2600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s university fees. He will be more than happy to see them achieve higher positions. In the future, he plans to take new Kiva loans to continue covering his children’s educational fees.

loans.use: pay his children’s university fees

loans.name: Donisa

texts.en:
Donisa is 29 years old and lives Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City.  She is married with one child. 

Donisa has a used clothing business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase bundles of used clothing to sell.

Donisa has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean, a 39-year-old married mother of four children, one of whom is in school, is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has operated a beauty products business in the Philippines for the past year. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. In the future, Mary Jean would like to develop and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en:
Inocencio is a farmer who lives in Carilucud, Solana where he grows rice to sell. His rice field is located 200 meters along his house. He has been planting rice for almost eight years. He got involved in this type of work because he only finished high school and has no other source of income besides farming. He wants to sustain his family's needs so he works hard to gain income from his farming business.

Right now he lacks funds so he is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and insecticides.

In the future, Inocencio aims to send his five children to college to earn a degree so that someday they can live successfully.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her two children who are still studying. She has been working as a teacher in a local school for the past twenty-one years. In parallel, she has also been teaching at a local university for three years. 

She’s working really hard to be able to fulfill her family needs and cover her children’s educational fees. Today, she’s looking to borrow $ 2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay her children’s university fees.  She notes that this will allow them continue their education in a proper way. In the future, she plans to earn money in order to enhance their way of living and offer her children a better future.

loans.use: to pay her children’s university fees.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is married with three children. Ludivina is 58 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Ludivina sells pigs to earn a living and had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase piglets and feed.

Ludivina joined PMPC in 2011. In the future, Ludivina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Torobay

texts.ru:
Торобай  работает на шахте, занимаясь поставкой материалов для укрепления забоев.  Ему 45 лет, женат, воспитывает двоих сыновей и дочь.  Жена Гульнара домохозяйка.
	В 1995 году Торобай начал свой бизнес  в животноводстве, купив одну козу на сумму 600 сом, что послужило стартом его собственного бизнеса.
 Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Торобая имеются 2 дойные коровы, 2 нетели, 2 лошади, приносящее примерно 8,000 - 9,000 сом в месяц. Доходы от деятельности  позволили Торобаю купить легковой автомобиль для семьи. 
	
Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Торобай обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. 
В будущем, Торобай планирует расширять поголовье скота за счет баранов и коз.
texts.en:
Torobay works at a mine, supplying materials for mine face reinforcement. He is 45 years old, married, and is bringing up two sons and a daughter. His wife, Gulnara, is a homemaker. 

In 1995 Torobay started his livestock breeding business, buying one goat for 600 som, which served as the beginning of his own business. Because of his persistent work, there are now 2 dairy cows, 2 heifers, and 2 horses on Torobay's farm, bringing in approximately 8,000 - 9,000 som a month. His business income has allowed Torobay to purchase a car for his family. 

In order to further develop his business, Torobay asked Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of dairy cows. In the future, Torobay plans to increase the number of livestock by acquiring sheep and goats.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four working children. They all cooperate together to enrich their life and live properly. She started her own home business as a tailor eight years ago and has already thirty years of experience in the tailoring field. As for her husband, he owns a textiles shop. 

Today, Mona needs to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a tailoring machine and added raw materials such as textiles. She’s sure that this loan will boost her productivity, therefore her sales and thus her revenues.  In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and added raw materials such as textiles.

loans.name: Sanoatchon

texts.ru: Саноатчон 38 лет, замужем, имеет  4 детей. С нашей организацией сотрудничает с 2010 года. Имеет  дехканское хозяйство, выращивает виноград, абрикос, гранат и другие фрукты. Она арендует 1 Га земли не далеко от своего дома.  Муж подрабатывает  грузчиком в России  в кондитерской фабрике. От полученной суммы присылает ежемесячно деньги. Дети помогают ей в дехканском хозяйстве.  В начале весны сажает семена с детьми  и начиная с осени до зимы продает свой урожай. Кредит получила для покупки авиабилета для мужа.
texts.en: Sanoatchon is 38 years old, married and has four children.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2010.  She owns a dekhan farm, where she grows grapes, apricots, pomegranate and other fruits.  Sanoatchon leases one hectare of land not far away from her house.  Her husband works as a loader at a confectionery factory in Russia.  He sends money from his earning every month.  Their children help with the dekhan farm.  Sanoatchon and her children plant seeds at the beginning of spring and sell their harvest from autumn to winter.  She is obtaining this loan to purchase an airline ticket for her husband.

loans.use: to purchase an airline ticket for her husband

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima was born in 1957 in Vazashen village, in the Tavush area. Now she and her family live in Ijevan city. Rima is married and has two sons. One of her sons is married and lives separately from his parents. Rima’s husband goes to Russia for seasonal work once a year.
Rima and her son who lives with parents have run their own trading business since 2000. In their shop they sell food, beverages and household goods. Rima’s business helps her to meet her family’s needs for the most part. 
In advance of New Year’s holiday, Rima intends to diversify her shop's assortment of goods, so she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a large quantity of sweets, sugar, flour, butter, juice and household goods to resell. 
This is Rima’s third loan from Kiva partner Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of sweets, sugar, flour, butter, juice and different household goods to resell.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy  lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with six children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (orphans). She sells bananas and also fish at the market. She has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week and generates additional income through selling charcoal. 

Teddy has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy fish and bunches of bananas. Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her "matooke" (green banana) business into wholesale .She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to piped water or electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and fish  for her stall.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. Neither of them is in school. She has had a business selling tea in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Achol requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for sale.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en: Cesar is 43 years old and is married to Maricel who had a retail store in front of their house. Cesar also grows rice for future merchandise in the store. They help each other in making their family achieve progress. Cesar had been in the farming business for almost 30 years. Cesar realized that through the years his farming business was not increasing its yield - he had constant production and income. He asks for a loan of P30,000 to buy farm inputs to use to improve his crop for additional net profits. He will buy three bags of rice seeds and six sacks of fertilizers and insecticides use in farming. With these inputs he knows that it will help increase his yield and someday help him improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seeds and six sacks of fertilizers and insecticides use in farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for his retail business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for her café and also to carry out farming.

loans.name: Akur

texts.en:
Akur is a 42-year-old married woman with six children. Four of them are in the school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Akur requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Azraa

texts.en:
Azraa is 32 years old, married with two children, and lives in Iraq.

Azraa has had a beauty salon since 2005, providing hair styling, cuts and coloring, make-up and beauty care. She has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. She has a good reputation and she is well-known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $1,800 loan in order to purchase a skin cleaning machine and new tools for her salon. She is aiming to increase her profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a skin cleaning machine and new tools for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and a heifer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pearls

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Ntopesi Ndembo Group

texts.en:
Tefrida is a 52 year old a mother of eight children. She is good at farming activities including producing coffee, maize and beans for over six years. She has been facing serious problems based on lack of fertilizers and insecticides for her growing crops.

Tefrida will use the additional working capital to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. For five years, her dream has been to boost her scale of production from 5 to 12 acres, and to remedy her own house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en: Nyiel, a 35-year-old  married mother of five children, two of whom are in school, has had a business selling charcoal in Bor South Sudan for the past two years. Now requesting a loan of $375 through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal, Nyiel will use the resulting extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more vines to plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize, groundnuts, and coffee to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy in clothing for her business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya and is married with  two children aged 7 and 9. His farm currently produces  milk and tea for the local market. He maintains his family with his farming revenue which is their sole source of income.

Robbert has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He believes he will be able to educate his children with the dairy income. He adds he will build a better dairy unit for his animals and appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their loan services.

Robbert is however worried by the constant high cost of animal feed. He is aged 39 and married.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adol

texts.en: Adol, a 25-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school, has operated a business selling charcoal in Bor South Sudan for two years. Adol has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal, and will use the resulting extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has four children.

Taleb is a photographer; in 2009 he decided to open his own store for photography, photocopying and stationeries. He has a sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply $2100 loan in order to purchase a modern camera. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a modern camera.

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and has one child.

Raafat is a carpenter; in 2008, he decided to open his own workshop. He makes bedrooms and furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation, and he is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for $2400 loan in order to purchase a large generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large generator.

loans.name: Rakhad

texts.ru:
Рахад  38 лет, замужем, растит 4-х детей, младшей из которых 1 месяц. Рахад работала преподавателем в средней школе села Гульча, но из-за низкой заработной платы, она была вынуждена оставить свою профессию.   В 2001 году Рахад начала свой бизнес в торговле канцелярскими товарами.  Стартовав с суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS), Рахад сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 10,000 сом.   
В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Рахад обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Рахад мечтает открыть свой собственный магазин с канцтоварами.
texts.en:
Rakhad is 38 years old, married and raising 4 children, the youngest of whom is 1 month old. Rakhad worked as a teacher in a high school in the village Gulcha, but because of low wages, she was forced to leave her profession. In 2001 Rakhad started her business in the stationary trade. Starting with the amount of 10,000 som (KGS), Rakhad was able to develop her business with a monthly income in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to expand her assortment of goods, Rakhad turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS). Rakhad dreams of opening her own stationary shop.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 44-year-old, married father of nine. His seven youngest children are minors and attend school. Samwel has been farming for 15 years, and he currently has a farm where milk and tea are his main products.

Samwel has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, his second from the organization. He believes that the income will enable him to educate his children. He adds that his focus is to raise purebreds.

Samwel laments his business challenges, which include the unreliable artificial insemination services provided in the area as well as rampant diseases.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ayor

texts.en:
Ayor is a 40-year-old, married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She has run a clothing business in Bor, South Sudan, for one year.

Ayor has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is from the village of Kolagi, in the Kakheti Region. He is 64 years old and lives with his wife, Nina. Giorgi and Nina earn their living through agricultural activities. They own a 2-hectare peach orchard and a 0.14-hectare vineyard. Giorgi sells his grapes and peaches locally. The family's total average monthly income is 700 laris.

Giorgi has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for the peach orchard. After proper fertilization, Giorgi can count on a good harvest next year, which will bring additional income to the family. He will also use part of the loan to pay his seasonal workforce.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay his workforce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animals for meat.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 52 years old, a farmer for 20 years. He lives with his five children. Until now, this has been the source of funds for the education of his children. Now, he wants to improve and develop his business for the sake of his children’s education. He is now asking a loan amount P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides use to improve his business.

He hopes through this loan he will be able to gain better crops for him to save for his children and lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his stock of his goods.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cartloads of firewood

loans.name: Bahri

texts.ru: Бахри работает на станции скорой помощи дежурным-диспетчером в течении 15 лет. У нее трое сыновей, муж умер 8 лет назад. Двоих последних сыновей женила сама, купила им квартиру. В настоящее время  ее сыновья находятся в России один уехал  с женой, но своих детей оставил ей на попечение. Она одна растит своих внуков - школьников, покупает еду, одежду и прочие вещи. Иногда присылает деньги их отец. Другой сын также уехал и оставил свою жену Бахри, она домохозяйка и Бахри также ей  дает деньги на еду и одежду. Сейчас им необходимо купить стиральную машинку, купив машинку у ее невестки останется больше времени для  детей и другого домашнего хозяйства. Сыновья Бахри обещали присылать деньги матери для покупки нового телевизора на новый год. Она не рассчитывает на  присылаемые деньги от своих детей, а планирует  сама делать покупки и не хочет от них зависеть, потому что она считает, что у каждого сына есть своя семья  и они должны обеспечивать свою семью, а она со своими силами сама справиться, потому что получает заработную плату и пенсию.
texts.en: Bahri has been working as an on-duty dispatcher at a medical emergency service for 15 years.  She has three sons, and her husband passed away eight years ago.  She married off two of her youngest sons and purchased them an apartment.  Currently, her sons are in Russia, and one of them left with his wife, but left the children for Bahri to support.  Bahri is raising her school-age grandchildren by herself, buys them food, clothing and other things.  Sometimes, their father sends back money.  Bahri's other son also left and left his wife, who is a homemaker, and Bahri also gives her money for food and clothing.  Currently, they need to purchase a washing machine because, having bought the appliance, her daughter-in-law would have more time for the children and other household work.  Bahri's sons promised to send money to their mother to buy a new television for the New Year's holiday.  She, however, does not rely on money sent by her sons and plans to make the purchases on her own.  Bahri does not want to depend on her sons because she thinks that since each son has his own family, they should provide for their families, and she can use her own efforts to support her needs because she earns a salary and a pension.

loans.use: to purchase a washing maсhine

loans.name: Parandzem

texts.en: Parandzem lives together with her husband and sons. She is engaged in agriculture. Parandzem needs some financial investments to improve the condition of her orchard. With the loan's help Parandzem will protect her orchard better and develop it. Parandzem will receive more harvest, with the help of which she will sustain her family and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for columns and wires to protect her orchard

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor to prune, harvest, and transport produce.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of manioc, 15 large bundles of plantains, 10 sacks of yams, and 7 sacks of sweet potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy posts and wires and to perform maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase in bulk 25 crates of beverages for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu lives in Likoni, Kenya. She owns a video show room which has been in operation for two years. She started the business out of her household savings. After being introduced to Milango by her friends, Mwanamkuu is now applying for a loan of Ksh 30,000 to buy more video cassettes for showing and for sale. 
Her ambition for the future is to open other video show rooms and also to have a video library. The main challenge is the seasonality of the business. Since Coast Province where Likoni lives is a tourist area, when the season is low, she also makes fewer sales.
Mwanamkuu will use the extra income obtained from the loan to renovate the show room to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy more video cassettes for show and for sale.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак три года как кредитуется в нашей организацией. Ей 29 лет, она не замужем, живет со своими родителями. Продает на улице продукты питания и другие мелочи. На её прилавке можно найти конфеты, печенье, напитки и фрукты. Торгует она с 6 вечера до 11 ночи, так как она днем работает бухгалтером. Она копит деньги на однокомнатную квартиру и хочет переехать. Кроме ее родителей, с ними живут также ее брат с семьей. Муборак хочет увеличить запас товаров, так как под Новый год у нее намечается хорошая торговля, для чего просит кредит.
texts.en: Muborak has been obtaining financing from our organization for three years.  She is 29 years old, single and lives with her parents.  She sells food products and other small things on the street.  Candies, cookies, beverages and fruits can be found in her food stall.  Muborak sells from six in the evening to eleven at night because she works as an accountant during the day.  She is saving money for a one-room apartment and wants to move.  Besides her parents, Muborak's brother and his family also live with them. Muborak wants to increase her inventory of goods, as she expects to have high sales during the New Year holidays season.

loans.use: to expand her business and purchase candies, cookies, beverages and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, tomatoes and corn oil for her restaurant.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргизе 30 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2002 года. Муж работает  парикмахером. Наргиза торгует на рынке детской и женской одеждой, за товаром ездит сама. Привозит товар каждую неделю на такси. У нее есть маленькие дети, она оставляет их дома на  попечение свекрови. Торгуя на рынке она копит деньги на покупку квартиры. Кредит получает на увеличение товарооборота, а именно теплых видов одежды.
texts.en: Nargiza is 30 years old, married and has two children.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2002.  Her husband works as a barber.  Nargiza sells children's and women's clothing at a market and travels for merchandise herself.  She brings in merchandise every week, using a taxi.  Nargiza has small children and leaves them with her mother-in-law to look after.  She is saving money for the purchase of an apartment by selling at the market.  She is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.en:
Atanacio is 45 years of age and blessed with four children. He is satisfied in his work as a farmer. He stated that although he couldn't finish his education, he has a fruitful occupation that serves as a source of income for his family's every need. 

He is sending all his children to school and hopes they attain their goals. It is not easy to provide for their educational needs because of the high cost of tuition. However, he works hard and requests a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy inputs to develop his farm. For better results, he needs to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. He also needs to pay for the labor of a co-farmer.

Hopefully, through his sacrifices and hard work, he can attain a better outcome, improve his family's poor living standards, and experience a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and pay for labor by a co-farmer

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Клиентка уже пользовалась кредитами КИВА и осталась очень довольна условиями и своевременно предоставленной финансовой помощью. Так как постоянные деловые отношения ей импонируют больше, Галина решила в очередной раз обратиться за кредитом в КИВА. Торгуя сумками и кошельками, Галина знает, что в предпраздничный период кошельки и портмоне хорошо расходятся среди покупателей в качестве подарков родным и близким, поэтому она берет кредит для закупки дополнительного количества кошельков для продажи во время праздников. 
Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Галина смогла завезти больше дорогого товара, а именно кожаные кошельки и ключницы и удачно его реализовала.  
Галина продолжает жить со своими детьми в доме и помогает им по возможности и финансово.
texts.en:
The client has previously received loan from Kiva and is very satisfied with the terms and timely financial assistance. As she is experiencing increased pressure from ongoing business dealings, Galina decided to request a loan from Kiva once again. Trading in handbags and wallets, Galina knows that in the season leading up to the holidays, wallets and purses sell well as gifts for family and friends, so she is taking out a loan to purchase additional wallets to sell during the holidays. 

Thanks to her previous loan, Galina was able to obtain more expensive merchandise, specifically, leather wallets and key case wallets, which she sold successfully. Galina continues to live with her children and helps them financially whenever possible.

loans.use: to purchase more wallets, which are a popular gift item during the holidays

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Предыдущий кредит Оксана использовала для того, чтобы закупить новые игрушки, разные заколки для волос девочкам, новогодние украшения и т.д. Благодаря увеличению ассортимента реализуемого товара у Оксаны увеличился стабильный доход на 1 500 гривен по сравнению с прошлым годом. Это очень ободрило Оксану и вселило в нее больше доверия к кредитным услугам КИВА. 
В этот раз Оксана берет кредит, так как у нее есть необходимость в обновлении товара. 
Сейчас Оксана ждет ребенка, она уже на 6 месяце. Вместе со своим гражданским мужем она живет в недавно приобретенном собственном доме.
texts.en:
Oksana used her previous loan to buy new toys, different hairpins for girls, Christmas decorations etc. Thanks to the increase in assortment of goods sold by Oksana, her stable income increased by 1,500 hryvnia compared with last year. This encouraged Oksana very much, and gave her more confidence in the KIVA loan service. 

This time Oksana is taking out a loan because she needs to restock the products. Currently Oksana is expecting a baby; she is already 6 months pregnant. Together with her common law husband, she lives in their newly purchased own home.

loans.use: to restock the products in her vending facility

loans.name: Hrachya

texts.en: Artak is a farmer from Malishka village. He keeps cattle and beehives. Artak lives with his wife, who helps him with agriculture. Artak would like to expand his farm, for which he needs sufficient financial investments. With the requested loan Artak plans to purchase livestock, hay, and beehives. Development of cattle breeding and beekeeping are very important for the community's agricultural development, as it will allow to create jobs in the future.

loans.use: to pay for livestock, hay, and beehives

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married father of four children aged between 14 and 2 years. He has been actively farming for 16 years with his farm currently producing tea and milk for the local market. His first loan with Juhudi Kilimo was 50,000 KES.

Charles has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to educate his children as well as provide their daily upkeep requirements. He says he sees a brighter future with dairy farming with the provision of a loan from Juhudi Kilimo and hopes to make his dairy farm a big business.

Charles appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services but laments on the rampant fluctuation in milk prices in the market.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 47-year-old married Lebanese man who lives with his wife and five children, two of whom are working. He is still the main income provider in the family, and is ready to help his children whenever they need it. He has owned an agricultural tractor and works on a free-lance basis since 2005. His work is specialized in excavating the land and preparing it for cultivation. Today, he is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to equip his tractor with the needed supplies so as to smooth his business operations. In that way, he will be able to take on more projects. In the future, he plans to purchase another tractor in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to equip his tractor with the needed supplies

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is engaged in agriculture. He keeps cattle and beehives. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, and it's barely enough to make ends meet, so Karen plans to expand his farm. With the requested loan he plans to purchase livestock, calves and beehives. Expansion of the farm will help Karen to increase his income and support his household economy. Karen lives with his wife and pensioner father.

loans.use: to pay for livestock, calves and beehives

location.town: Horbategh village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Chepkorir

texts.en:
Chepkorir is a mother of 2 children aged 4 and 3 years old and has been in mixed farming for 5 years. She currently produces tea, pineapples, bananas, and milk, which all go to the local market. She says she fully relies on farming for the upkeep of her family.

Chepkorir has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter for her dairy farming  business. She hopes this will reduce waste on feed and her production will improve significantly. She adds she will venture into other businesses in order to spread her farming risks. 

She is greatfull to Juhudi Kilmo for their loans which are uplifting the living standards of farmers.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en: Yar is a 32 year old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. For the past three years she has had a business selling bread in Bor, South Sudan.  She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more bread to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell.

loans.name: Colonne De Feu Plus Group

texts.en:
Furaha is the leader of the Community Bank named “Colonne de Feu Plus". It is composed of 20 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Furaha is 55 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children, whose ages range between 22 and 33 years old. Two of them attend school. She sells miscellaneous goods. She has been active in her business since 1974. She began her business running a general store. Furaha joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) in order to achieve her dream of someday opening a beverage facility in her environment and has already received two loans and repaid them properly. 

Thanks to Hope’s loans, Furaha’s business has prospered and it generates a profit of $50 per week. With the next loan, Furaha intends to buy more goods to resell at profit in order to increase her capital. She works hard in order to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing one more soya bean sack for reselling at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 35-year-old single woman who still lives with her family. 
Eight years ago, Rana prepared and bought all the equipment needed to open a beauty salon. She also registered her business officially to start in the right way. During the past eight years, Rana also added a rental wedding dress service for brides.
Now Rana has applied for a loan to redecorate the salon and expand the space. In the future, she wants to open a separate shop for wedding dress rental.

loans.use: to redecorate the salon and expand the space.

loans.name: Nyawak

texts.en: Nyawak is a 23 year old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past three years she has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan.  She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has been a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya for the last five years. Her farm produces potatoes, cabbages and carrots for the local market.

She is married with one child, aged 4, with herself being 32. She has one farmhand. She also runs a second-hand clothes business. 

Catherine has requested a loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and expand her farming into poultry farming. She wants to use the income to repay the loan and improve her family's living standards. She adds that she will, in the future, venture into wheat farming once she has established her dairy and poultry businesses.

She laments pest damage on their produce and the lack of finances.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Bolotshi Plus Group

texts.en:
Bolotshi Plus is a group of 20 owners of small businesses chaired by Mpoyi. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Mpoyi is 36 years old. His main business is selling plastic packaging. Besides selling plastic packaging, he also sells lamp oil. He buys them in bulk and resells them at retail at a profit. He sells his products daily at the market in his area, located west of Kinshasa.

Mpoyi started his business in 2000. He is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having two times obtained and correctly repaid loans. His next loan will allow him to buy plastic packaging in larger quantities to increase his sales in order to make a better profit. Mpoyi makes a profit of about $30 USD per week. The aims of this loan are mainly for food and school fees for his children. He is married and the father of two children whose ages are two and six years old. One child attends school.

loans.use: to buy plastic packaging in larger quantities and to resell them at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Yar

texts.en: Yar is a 30 year old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. For the past three years she has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan.  She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: o purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jamala

texts.en:
Jamala is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of six and 16. Two of them go to school. 

Jamala runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for 10 years. He has one employee. Jamala heard about Finance Sudan from his fellow clients in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 1000 to purchase items like milk, coffee, Tang juice, sugar, Nomi and others. Jamala has no source of income other than this business.  

In five years time, Jamala hopes to change his business to a big wholesale store.

His major challenges include high rate of outgoing money because his wife is not employed.

Jamala says that Finance Sudan Should continue in the country.

loans.use: to purchase items like milk, coffee, Tang juice, sugar, Nomi, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chairs and cutlery for her restaurant.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 33-year-old hardworking and artistic woman. She is married and a mother of three children.
Amal is talented in making pottery from A to Z. She creates the shape, then puts it in a small grill, then paints or draws on it with special colours. It has been two years now since she started her business, and she has made and sold a lot of pottery.
Now Amal has applied for a loan to purchase a special potter's grill and more clay to make the pottery.

loans.use: to purchase a special potter’s grill and more clay.

loans.name: Kikundi Cha Wauza Mitumba Mbinga Mjini Group

texts.en:
Issaya is a 37 year old married man with two children who are both attending primary education. He has been growing maize for over 12 years. He also runs business activities - especially buying and selling clothes. He has problems in his farming activities based on the high price of fertilizers, hoes and gum boots. He seeks more working capital for improving his agricultural activities.

Issaya has a goal of increasing his crop production from 2 to 10 acres and also to build a good house in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, hoes and gumboots

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
Muhamad is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of four and 10. Two of them go to school. 

Muhamad runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for nine years. He has no employees. Muhamad heard about Finance Sudan from fellow clients in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 1000 to purchase items like milk, cooking oil, biscuits, sweets, Nomi, and others. Muhamad has no source of income other than this business.

In five years time, Muhamad hopes to build a house before the children are increased in number.

His major challenges include home expenses being too high.

Muhamad says that he has become better because of Finance Sudan; he is raised up financially.

loans.use: to purchase items like milk, cooking oil, biscuits, sweets, Nomi, and others.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 25 year old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school.  For the past three years she has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan.  She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Tonui

texts.en:
Tonui is a farmer and a resident in his home area of  Litein, South Rift Kenya where he also provides veterinary services to the local farmers. He has been in farming for five years and currently provides pineapple, tea, banana, and milk for the local market. He is married with two children aged three and four years. He is 31 years old.

Tonui has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase artificial insemination containers to help in providing artificial insemination services to other farmers in the area. He adds that this will help boost his farming income through reinvesting the income from his services in farming and raise the living standards of his family. He hopes to increase the number of dairy cows in his farming business.

He says unreliability of produce prices and high costs of feed has made farming difficult.

loans.use: To buy artificial insemination containers for his farming business

loans.name: Abacker

texts.en:
Abacker is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of four and sixteen. Two of them go to school. 

Abacker runs a food eating place (hotel) business, and he has been in the business for three years. He has three employees. Abacker heard about Finance Sudan from the fellow clients in market. He is taking a loan of 1,000 to purchase items like saucepans food items and others. In addition to this business, Abacker has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Abacker would like to build a good hotel (food business) instead of renting.

His major challenges include the low income rate and high cost of the goods.


Abacker says that, God should bless Finance Sudan for the help.

loans.use: to purchase items like saucepans, food items, and other things

loans.name: Jameeleh

texts.en:
Jameeleh is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three daughters and sons, and they live in Al Rusaifeh where her husband works as a driver.
Jameeleh has a hobby knitting and embroidering fabric. Four years ago, with the prices of everything rising, Jameeleh started to use her hobby and talent to add another source of income to the family. She started embroidering dresses and making traditional dresses (as shown in the picture) for sale. At first, she made the dresses to order to avoid losing money, but now she makes larger quantities to sell to clothes shops.
Now Jameelah has applied for a loan to buy more fabric and materials in order to increase productivity. She hopes to open her own workshop in the future where she can employ more people to help her.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and material to increase productivity.

loans.name: Futjox

texts.en:
Futjox is a 41-year-old married woman with five children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Futjox requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 20-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Yar requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a primary school teacher in his hometown of Litein, South Rift, Kenya, where he also practices farming to supplement his teaching income. He is 26 years old, single, and has been actively farming for six years, producing pineapples and bananas for the local market. He works on the farm himself and employs one farmhand.

Collins has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry for a venture into the poultry farming business. He is optimistic that his farming business will continue to grow due to his experience in farming. He also hopes to build a modern dairy unit for his animals.

He is, however, worried about the increasing costs of animal feed and rampant disease.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Kikundi Cha Wilima Mbinga Mjini Group

texts.en:
Filbeth is 45 years old and the father of four children.  One child attends secondary school and the other three attend primary school.  He has been growing maize and beans on his four acres of land for over three years.  He faces a number of problems including the lack of fertilizer and insecticide for his crops.

Filbeth is requesting a loan in order to increase his working capital and purchase fertilizer and insecticide.  With the revenue generated from this loan he plans to pay school fees for his children and build a good house.   And, in five years time, he hopes to expand his acres under production to 12 from four.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 30-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has 2 children between the ages of ten and four months. Both of them go to school. Ibrahim runs a cosmetics store, and he has been in the business for ten years. This business is Ibrahim's only source of income. He has one employee. 

Ibrahim heard about Finance Sudan through a promotion done by the company's loan officers. He is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase items like Razack oil, Cocodam oil, Carolight oil, and other beauty products.  

In 5 years time, Ibrahim hopes to build or rent a good shop. His major challenges include competitors and a low income rate.

Ibrahim says that he appreciates the support of Finance Sudan and that God should bless the company.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth to expand her business.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Mambo Mkalanga Group

texts.en:
Romanus is 47 years old and the father of twelve children.  He is a good farmer and produces coffee, maize and beans.  In addition, he raises animals.  He faces a number of obstacles in his business including the high price of fertilizer and the lack of funds to purchase insecticide.

Romanus is requesting this loan in order to buy enough fertilizer and insecticide for his crops.  In five years time, he hopes to increase the scale of his production from nine to 17 acres and establish his own transportation facility.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide and gum boots.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Harriet has a food stall and works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last four years. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality.

Harriet's goals and aspirations are to build her own house and to educate her children at the university level. She rents a house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees, rent, and food.

Harriet has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas and tomatoes for sale.

loans.use: to buy bananas and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Ufunguo Kipoka Ndembo Group

texts.en:
Kandidus is a 29-year-old father of three children.  One of them attends primary school. He has worked in farming for 2 years, growing coffee, maize, and sugar cane. The lack of fertilizers and insecticides causes problems with his farming activities.  

Kandidus asks for working capital to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his crops. He is working hard, so as to boost his scale of production from 6 to 11 acres in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anger

texts.en:
Anger is a 20-year-old married woman with one child. Her child is not in school. She has sold charcoal in Dokuru bor, South Sudan for two years.

Anger requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. In the future, she plans to use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more poultry and pigs to resell

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). She sells matooke and fish at the market. She has been in this business for 8 years. She works 7 days a week. Teddy generates additional income by selling charcoal. She has requested for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy fish and bunches of matooke. Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her matooke business into wholesale. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish and bunches of matooke for selling

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 33-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 2 children between the ages of 6 and 3. Both of them go to school. 

Ibrahim runs a phone store business, and he has been in this business for 11 years. He has 1 employee. Ibrahim heard about Finance Sudan through a promotion done by the loans officers. He is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase items like new phones, phone chargers, and many others. Apart from this business, Ibrahim has no other source of income. 

In 5 years' time, Ibrahim would like to own a house and not be renting. His major challenges include the competitors and home expenses.

Ibrahim says that he has a lot of appreciation for Finance Sudan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase items like new phones, phone chargers, and many others

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 37 años de edad es casado tiene 7 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 18, 13, 10, 8, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Juan se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales, construcción, tiene sembríos de papas, trigo, maíz, arveja, siembra en terrenos de Arriendo, tiene 2 cabezas de ganado.
Las compra y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para destinarlo para la siembra de maíz (compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, mano de obra).
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la situación económica de la familia. El sueño es poder comprar terreno  y construir una vivienda, dar el estudio a los hijos.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta  son las plagas y enfermedades  en los cultivos y problemas de salud.
En los tiempos libres le gusta el deporte, salir de paseo con la familia fiestas del carnaval y San Pedro.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 37 years old, married and has 7 children.  He lives with his wife and his children ages 18, 13, 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.

He is a member of VRC VENTANAL, which is found in the community of Guantuncoto, in the parish of Julio Moreno in Cantón Guaranda, at a distance of 30 minutes from the office.  The inhabitants of the community work at different trades such as: agriculture, business, construction, and raising cattle, pigs, chickens, and sheep,. 

Juan works in agriculture, raising animals, and construction.  He has sown potatoes, wheat, corn, and green peas, planting in the fields of Arriendo. He has 2 head of cattle.

He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda.  He requests the loan to use for the planting of corn (purchase of fertilizers, seeds, labor). 

With the help of the loan, he will be able to improve the financial situation of his family.  His dream is to be able to purchase land and build a home and to provide education to his children.  The challenges that he faces are damages and diseases in the crops and health problems.

In his free time, he enjoys sports, and spending time with his family in the festivals of the carnival and San Pedro..

loans.use: to put it to use for the planting of corn (purchase of fertilizers, seeds, labor)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 8 children, but only 3 children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Ruth sells charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for 4 years. She works 6 days a week. She has requested for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her charcoal business into wholesale. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Yual

texts.en:
Yual is a 25-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling beer in Bor, South Sudan for the past two years.

Yual requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale

loans.name: Kikundi Cha Tamajiji Group
