texts.en: Fulko is a 71 year old married man with nine children. He has been growing coffee, maize and beans for over 12 years. He is seeking financial support to buy fertilizers and insecticides, which he currently lacks due to a shortage of working capital. He believes that within five years he will be able to increase his scale of production from 4 to 9 acres, and also to improve his house, television and clothes.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Gülden

texts.en:
Gulden is 33 years old, married and has two children.  For 15 years, she has been selling a variety of cosmetics to her neighborhood.  She finds that selling Oriflame products is more convenient and profitable than other cosmetic brands.  Additionally, she thinks that selling Oriflame products will widen her customer base.  With this loan she will buy these products wholesale. Oriflame has employee campaigns that give away promotional gifts that she can in turn sell and make more profit (these are not samples).  In the future, she wants to expand her business and make more profit.  She wants to use her monetary gains to support her children’s education.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff and volunteers

Gülden Hanım,33 yaşında,evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  Çevresine,komşularına  15 yıldır kozmetik ürünleri satıyor.  Yıllardır çeşitli ürünler pazarlamış,şu an yaptığı oriflame işi daha uygun ve karlı gelmiş.  Diğer işlere göre de daha kolay  pazarlandığını düşünüyor.  Çevresinin bu iş sayesinde çok genişlediğini düşünüyor.  Bu kredi ile toplu ürün alıcak.  Oriflame işinde ,zaman zaman kampanya yapılıp,birçok hediye veriliyor.  Bu hediyeleri de satabiliyorlar,böylece daha iyi para kazanıyorlar.  Gelecekte işini büyütmek  ve daha çok para kazanmak istiyor.  Gelecekte çocuklarının okullarına destek olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying flour, beans, and other foods

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Segundo Rodrigo

texts.es:
Segundo Rodrigo tiene 37 años de edad es viudo tiene 6 hijos, vive con los hijos de 16, 14, 12, 8, 6 y 4 años de edad en  Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales, construcción, comercio de productos que produce, tiene sembríos de papas, maíz, arveja, habas, tiene 1 cabeza de ganado, los terrenos en el que segundo siembra son propios.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para destinarlo en la siembra de maíz y comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea y líquidos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear al pueblo y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval y San Pedro.
Con la ayuda del crédito  anterior pudo comprar las semillas y abonos agricolas, mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia. El negocio ha aumentado por el buen trato en los cultivos, los ingresos han mejorado por los buenos productos.
texts.en:
Segundo Rodrigo is 37 years old and is a widow with 6 children.  He lives with his children, who are ages 16, 14, 12, 8, 6, and 4 years old in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.  

He is a member of the CRC VENTANAL group which can be found in the community of Guantuncoto, the Parish of Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, at a distance of 30 minutes from the office of "Los habitantes de la Comunidad" or "Community Inhabitants."  The group members work in different activities like agriculture, cattle, raising smaller animals like pigs, chickens and sheep, as well as sales and construction.

Segundo works in agriculture, raising animals, construction, and the sale of products that he produces.  He has field of potatoes, corn, beans, peas, 1 head of cattle.  The land that Segundo farms is his own.

He makes purchases and sales in Guaranda.  He is asking for a loan in order to plant corn and to buy various types of fertilizer.  

In his free time he likes to go to and walk about town and enjoy the festivities of the carnival and San Pedro.  

With the help of his previous credit he was able to buy seeds and agricultural fertilizers, to improve the style of life of his family.  The business has grown through his good treatment of the crops, and income has improved due to good products.

loans.use: to plant corn and to buy various types of fertilizer.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren) Annet has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Annet sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of fruits like mangoes, oranges and water melons. The main business challenges for Annet include transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her business into a wholesale one and also to open up another branch in the same market. Annet lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of mangoes, oranges, and water melon

loans.name: Seliman

texts.en:
Seliman is a 30-year-old businessman, who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children, ages eight and four. Both of them go to school. 

Seliman runs a radio store business and has been in the business for 12 years. He has one employee. Seliman heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion done by the loan officers. He is taking out a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase items like a new radio, phone chargers, and phone lines. Seliman has no source of income other than this business. 

Seliman hopes to increase the size of his business in five years' time. 

His major challenges include competitors and home expenses.

Seliman says that he has a lot of appreciation for Finance Sudan for giving him the loan to uplift his business.

loans.use: to purchase items like a new radio, phone chargers, and phone lines.

loans.name: Anok

texts.en:
Anok is a 42-year-old a married woman with five children. All of them are in the school. She has had a business of selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Anok requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, onions and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, onions and rice for sale.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel tiene 55 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales además trabaja en la construcción, tiene sembríos de maíz, papas, habas, trigo, arveja los terrenos en los que siembra son propios y 2 cabezas de ganado lechero.

Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para poder sembrar maíz comprar abonos, fertilizantes, líquidos,  urea y otros abonos .

Con la ayuda del préstamo espera que la producción mejore para obtener mejores utilidades.
El sueño es comprar terrenos en la zona de la costa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la presencia de plagas en los cultivos.
El sueño es poder pasear, visitar a familiares y amigos y disfrutar las festividades del carnava y San Pedro

Con la ayuda del prèstamo ANTERIOR pudo comprar los insumos para la siembra, las semillas, la relación con la familia ha mejorado en un 100 porciento, el trabajo y los ingresos han aumentado para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel is 55 years old and is married with 5 children.  He lives with his wife and kids in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.  He is a member of the group VRC VENTANAL which can be found in the community of Guantuncoto, in Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda Parish, at a distance of 30 inutes from the Kiva partner's office.  The group members work in various activities, including agriculture, cattle, raising small animals like pigs, chickens and sheep, sales and construction.

Segundo works in agriculture, raising animals and working construction.  He also plants corn, potatoes, beans, wheat, and peas. The land that he farms is his own, and he also has two milking cows.  

He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda.  He is requesting a loan in order to plant corn and purchase various types of fertilizers.  

With the help of the loan he hopes that his production will improve in order to obtain better earnings.  His dream is to buy land in the coastal zone.  The challenges that he faces are the presence of pests in the fields.  He dreams of being able to go walking around, visiting family and friends and enjoying the festivities of the carnival and San Pedro.  

With the help of the previous loan he was able to purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting.  His relationship with his family has improved 100 percent.  The work and income has increased for the benefit of the family.

loans.use: to plant corn and purchase various types of fertilizers.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). 

Teo has a business of selling animal and chicken feeds. She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Teo sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Teo has requested for a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more bags of chicken and animal feeds. 

The main business challenge(s) for Teo include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her business into a wholesale one. Teo lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken  and animal feeds.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna trades in food from a rented booth in a city market. Ruzanna would like to expand her business by selling more food. With the loan's help Ruzanna will develop her business and increase her income. Additional income is vital for Ruzanna and her family, as she'll be able to cover her three student daughters' educational costs and insure better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for food inventory

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María Concepción tiene 55 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 39, 30, 26 y 24 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.

María se dedica a la Agricultura y crianza de animales. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para mejorar la actividad agrícola comprar fertilizantes, urea, abonos agrícolas, líquidos. 

Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudará a mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia y podrá comprarse un terreno. El sueño es poder tener un buen método para que mejore la calidad de crianza de animales.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades causales,, las plagas enfermedades en la agricultura.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las fechas de los finados y disfrutar de los carnavales.
Con la ayuda del prestamo anterior pudo mejorar un poco el estilo econòmico de la familia, los ingresos han aumentado un poco más y el trabajo a crecido un poco pero se espera que con este nuevo crédito pueda mejorar aun màs.
texts.en:
María Concepción is 55 years old and is married with four children.  She lives with her husband and her children who are 39, 30, 26 and 24 years of age.  They live in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.

She is a member of the group VRC VENTANAL which can be found in the community of Guantuncoto, in Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda Parish, at a distance of 30 inutes from the office.  The group members work in various activities, including agriculture, cattle, raising small animals like pigs, chickens and sheep, sales and construction.

María works in agriculture and raising animals.  She buys and sells in Guaranda.  She is asking for a loan in order to improve her agricultural work by buying various fertilizers.

With the help of the loan she will be able improve the quality of life of her family and be able to buy land.  Her dream is to be able to find a good method to improve the quality of the animals that she raises.  

The challenges that she faces include illnesses and plagues that affect agriculture.  In her free time she enjoys the Day of the Dead celebrations and the carnivals.  With the help of the previous loan she was able to improve a little the economic situation of her family.  Her income has increased a bit more and the work as grown some but she hopes that with this new credit she will be able to improve her situation even more.

loans.use: to improve her agricultural work by buying various fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María Juana  tiene 39 años de edad es casada tiene 6 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 20, 18, 12, 6, 4 y 6 meses de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.

María se dedica a la agricultura y quehaceres domésticos en la casa. Las compras y las ventas  los hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para poder sembrar maíz comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá invertirlo en la agricultura para poder obtener buenas utilidades.
El sueño es poder tener un micro mercado. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la sequedad del tiempo o mucho invierno.En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.

Con la ayuda del préstamo anterior pudo comprar lo necesario para la siembra como: abonos y fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas. La situación económica de la familia ha mejorado. La relación con la familia se esta fortaleciendo aun más.
"Esta muy agrdecida por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
María Juana is 39 years old and is married with 6 children.  She lives with her husband and her children ages 20, 18, 12, 6, 4 and 6 months in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.

She is a member of the group VRC VENTANAL which can be found in the community of Guantuncoto, in Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda Parish, at a distance of 30 minutes from the loan office.  The group members work in various activities, including agriculture, cattle, raising small animals like pigs, chickens and sheep, sales and construction.

María works in agriculture and in domestic work at home.  She buys and sells in Guaranda.  She is asking for a loan in order to plant corn and purchase seeds and fertilizers.  With the help of the loan she will be able to invest in agriculture in order to obtain better yields.  Her dream is to be able to have a mini market.  The challenges that she faces include drought or too much winter.  In her free time she likes to enjoy the carnival festivities.  

With the help of her previous loan she was able to purchase the necessary items to plant such as fertilizers.  The economic situation of her family has improved.  Her relationship with her family has grown even stronger.  "She is very thankful for the help provided."

loans.use: to plant corn and purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nyantiop

texts.en:
Nyantiop is a 30-year-old a married woman with four children. Two of them are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for five years.

Nyantiop requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 2 children and her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.

She has retail shop and also sells water at the market. She has been in business for 3 years. She also has rental houses as her other source of income. She works six days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour and sugar. Her major business challenge is the change in prices of commodities, electricity and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses and also own a fully stocked shop. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Mahoko Group

texts.en:
Gotham is a 40 year old married man with no children. He has been growing coffee, maize and beans for over six years. He faces a number of agricultural problems, such as a lack of fertilizers. He is struggling to find funds to finance his agricultural activities, especially buying fertilizers.

Gotham is a hard worker who hopes to expand his scale of production from 5 to 15 acres within five years. He also wishes to improve his house and own his own transportation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Laura Piedad

texts.es:
Laura Piedad es casada tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 6, 3 años de edad y 15 días de nacido en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Laura se dedica a la agricultura crianza de animales, siembra de maíz, habas, trigo, cebada tiene casa propia los terrenos en los que siembra son de familiares.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y pagar a las `personas que le ayudan.
Con la ayuda  podrá mejorar la producción.
El sueño es poder hacer una casa para que viva. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval y San Pedro.
Con la ayuda del crédito anteriuor pudo mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia, los ingresos han mejorado
texts.en:
Laura Piedad is married and has 3 children.  She lives with her husband and children ages 6, 3 and a 15 day-old newborn in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.  

She is a member of the group VRC VENTANAL which can be found in the community of Guantuncoto, in Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda Parish, at a distance of 30 minutes from the loan office.  The group members work in various activities, including agriculture, cattle, raising small animals like pigs, chicken and sheep, and working in sales and construction.

Laura works in agriculture raising animals, planting corn, beans, wheat, and barley.  She owns her own home and the land that she plants is owned by family.  She buys and sells in Guaranda.  She is asking for a loan in order to plant corn, to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the people that help her.  With their help she can improve her production.

Her dream is to be able to build her own home.  The challenges that she faces include plagues and illnesses in the crops and livestock.  In her free time she enjoys the festivities of carnival and San Pedro.

With the help of her previous loan she was able to improve the quality of life of her family, and her income has improved.

loans.use: to plant corn, to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the people that help her.

loans.name: Adum

texts.en:
Adum is a 30-year-old a married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for seven years.

Adum requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Kimya Plus Group

texts.en:
Kimya Plus is a Community Bank of 12 owners of small businesses chaired by Nzenza. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRCongo to grow their businesses.
Nzenza 39, single, is an itinerant photographer in his area located in the west of Kinshasa. He is well known and has many customers throughout the city of Kinshasa. He became a microentrepreneur in 1996. He has already received seven loans from Kiva through Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. He intends to use the next loan to purchase some camera accessories and photo frames to resell in order to reinforce his working capital. Currently, he earns a profit of US$60 per week. Nzenza is the father of a nine-year-old son who attends school.

loans.use: to purchase some camera accessories and photo frames to resell in order to reinforce his working capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es:
Luis Gonzalo tiene 25 años de edad es casado tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 6, 4 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Luis se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, construcción, crianza de animales y carpintería. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para poder sembrar maíz y darle mantenimiento con los abonos, fertilizantes, urea. 
Con la ayuda del préstamo sería mejor la calidad del producto y podrá apoyar a los hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando.
El sueño es poder tener una casa propia y un  terreno. El desafío que se le ha presentado son los problemas familiares. En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval y Semana Santa.
 Con la ayuda del crédito anterior  los ingresos aumentaron y mejoró la economía de la familia, la producción ha mejorado los productos son de calidad.
texts.en:
25-year old Luis Gonzalo is married and has three children. He lives with his wife and children aged 6, 4, and 2 in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Luis belongs to the Guantucoto community bank in the parish of Julio Moreno in Guaranda canton, located half an hour from the main office. The members of the community work in agriculture, raise livestock such as pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce, and construction.

Luis is a farmer but also works in construction, raises animals, and does carpentry. He is seeking a loan so he can sow his corn crop and buy manure, fertilizer, and urea. The purchases will help to improve the quality of his crops and enable him to support his children so they can continue with their education. 

His dream is to have a house of his own and buy some land. The challenges he faces are the usual ones. In his free time he enjoys going to festivities such as carnivals and Semana Santa.

With previous loan money Luis managed to increase his income and improve his family’s economic situation. His crops were also of better quality

loans.use: to buy corn and supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and urea

loans.name: Abiai

texts.en:
Abiai is a 30-year-old married woman with three children all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for four years.
Abiai requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis Arturo tiene 21 años de edad es casado tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de  de 2, 3 y 1 año de edad  en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura, avicultura además se dedica a la construcción y el deporte.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos y mejorar la situación económica de la familia y tener buenos progresos.
Con la ayuda del crédito utilizará muy bien el dinero y poder invertir en la agricultura.
El sueño es poder tener otro negocio que incremente los ingresos para mejoras de la familia.
El desafío que se le han presentado es la sequedad del tiempo o mucho invierno. En los tiempos libres le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
Con la yuda del crédito anterior pudo comprar los insumos, abonos, semillas para mejorar la producción. mejoró la calidad de vida de la familia, los ingresos han mejorado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
21-year old Luis Arturo is married and has three children. He lives with his wife and children aged 2, 3, and 1 in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Luis belongs to the Guantucoto community bank in the parish of Julio Moreno in Guaranda canton, located half an hour from the main office. The members of the community work in agriculture, raise livestock such as pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce, and construction.

Luis is a farmer and raises poultry. He also works in construction. He enjoys sport. He buys goods and sells his produce in Guaranda.

Luis is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea, manure so he can improve the financial situation of his family and make progress. He will make good use of the money by spending it on supplies for his crops. His dream is to have another business so he can increase his income and improve his family’s situation.

The challenges that Luis faces are lack of rain or too long a winter. In his free time he enjoys going to festivals and carnivals. 

With his previous loan he was able to buy farm supplies, fertilizer and seeds and improve production. He improved his family’s standard of living and his income increased satisfactorily.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea, and manure

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en: Aminah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and 1 child goes to school. She has no additional family members. She buys scrap at the market. She has been in this business for 3 years. She also has a beauty salon as her other source of income. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy a weighing scale. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, and rent.

loans.use: To buy a weighing scale

loans.name: Rosa Lida

texts.es:
Rosa Lida es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura crianza de animales, tiene sembrios de maíz, papas, trigo, cebada, el siembra en terrenos propios.
Las compras y las ventas  lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar terrenos, abonos, semillas y poder sembrar.
Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá tener espacio para poder cultivar y tener más producción. El sueño es construir una casa y poder dar el estudio a los hijos.
El desafío que ha diario se ha enfrentado es la presencia de plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse a la familia, salir a pasear y disfrutar de las fiestas del carnaval y San Pedro.
texts.en:
Rosa Lida is married with three children. She lives with her husband and children aged 6, 4, and 1 in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Luis belongs to the Ventanal community bank located in the community of Guantuncoto in the parish of Julio Moreno in Guaranda canton, located half an hour from the main office. The members of the community work in agriculture, raise livestock such as pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce, and construction.

Rosa is a farmer and also raises animals. She grows maize, potatoes, wheat, barley on land which she owns. She buys goods and sells her produce in Guaranda. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy more land, fertilizer, and seeds so she can plant her fields. 

With the assistance of the loan she will have a greater area to plant and will increase production. Her dream is to build a house and be able to provide an education for her children.
 
A daily challenge is the pests and diseases that attack her crops. In her free time she likes spending time with her family, going out for walks, and enjoying carnivals and the festival of San Pedro.

loans.use: to buy land, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es:
Juan Rafael tiene 37 años de edad es casado tiene 9 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 17, 15, 13, 11, 9, 7, 5, 3 y 1 año de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
 Juan  se dedica a la agricultura, maestro carpintero además es albañil y mecánico.
Las compras y las ventas de los productos de la agricultura lo hace en Guaranda, solicita el crédito para la agricultura y mejorar los cultivos comprando fertilizantes, abonos, urea, líquidos.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá dar el estudio a los hijos para que puedan superarse. El sueño es poder hacer un mejoramiento de la vivienda y aumentar las crías de ganados.
Los desafíos que se le ha presentado son las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta festejar de los festividades del carnaval, San Pedro.
texts.en:
Juan Rafael is 37 years old and is married.  He lives with his wife and their 9 children ages 17,15,13,11,9,7,5,3 and 1 in Guaranda in the Bolívar Province.  He is a member of the communal bank Ventanal in the community of Guantuncoto, located in the Julio Moreno parish in the canton of Guaranda, 30 minutes from the office.  The residents of this community work in different activities such as agriculture, raising livestock, raising other animals (pigs, chickens, sheep), business and construction.   

Juan works in agriculture as well as being a master carpenter, mason and mechanic.  He makes his agricultural purchases and sales in Guaranda.  He is requesting a loan for agricultural purposes and to improve his crops.  He will buy fertilizers, manure, urea and liquid fertilizers.  

With the help of the loan he will be able to give his children an education so that they can excel.  His dream is to be able to make improvements to his home and increase his livestock.  Crop insects are a challenge that he faces.  In his free time he likes to take part in the San Pedro Festival.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, manure, urea and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es: El señor Antenor tiene su vehiculo, un minibús, el cual lo utiliza para brindar servicios de transporte de pasajeros; su esposa es promotora de ventas. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo, pues es su herramienta de trabajo. Antenor es casado y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Hermoso de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con las condiciones del crédito y es la primera vez que trabaja con kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Antenor has a vehicle, a minibus, that he uses to provide passenger transport services. His wife is a sales promoter. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for complete maintenance of his vehicle, since it is the piece of equipment that he uses for work. Antenor is married and has two children. He lives in his own home in the District of Villa Hermoso in the city of La Paz.

Antenor is very pleased with the loan conditions. This is the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Sara Martha

texts.es:
Sara Martha tiene 19 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con lel hijo de 1 año de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Sara se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales, siembra de maíz, papas, trigo, cebada en terrenos al partido, vive en casa de los suegros.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz comprar abonos agrícolas, urea. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá mejorar la producción y los ingresos económicos.
El sueño es poder comprar terreno, construir una casa.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear, disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval y San Pedro.

Con la ayuda del préstamo anterior pudo mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia, los ingresos y la producción han aumentado en buena cantidad.
texts.en:
Sara Martha is 19, married, and has a one-year-old child. They live together in the Guaranda province of Bolívar.
She is a member of the Ventanal communal bank in the Guantuncoto community, in the Julio Moreno parish, Guaranda canton. They are located 30 minutes from the Los Habitantes de la Comunidad office. The members work in various areas, such as: agriculture, livestock, raising animals (hogs, chickens, sheep), commerce, and construction.
Sara works in agriculture, raising animals and sowing corn, potatoes, wheat, and barley. She lives in the home of her parents-in-law.
She makes her purchases and sales in Guaranda. She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and for purchasing fertilizers and urea. With the help of this loan, she will be able to improve her production and her income.
Her dream is to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.
Pests and plagues are challenges for her as a farmer. In her free time she likes to go out for walks and enjoy the carnivals and the San Pedro festival.
With the help of her previous loan she was able to improve her family's lifestyle. Her income and production have improved nicely.

loans.use: to plant corn and to buy fertilizers and urea; with the help of this loan she will be able to improve her production and income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar tiene 38 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 4, 19, 15, 14 y 1 año de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Julio se dedica a la agricultura, avicultura y construcción. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, líquidos. 
Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá mejorar la situación económica de la familia.  El sueño es poder tener un micro mercado y otras actividades más buenas qué generen ganancia.
El desafíos al que se enfrenta es la sequedad   del tiempo o a veces el invierno.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar las festividades del carnaval.
Con la yuda del crédito anterior pudo comprar las semillas, abonos agricolas, la situación de la familia ha mejorado, la producción ha aumentado para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 38 years old, married, and has 5 children. He lives with his wife and children, aged 19, 15, 14, 4, and 1, in Guaranda, Bolivar province.

Julio is a member of the “Ventanal” (Large Window) Communal Bank, composed of residents of Guantuncoto community in the parish of Julio Moreno, Guaranda canton, some 30 minutes from our offices. The inhabitants of this community are dedicated to differing activities, such as agriculture, cattle raising, caring for pigs, chickens, and sheep, commerce, and construction.

Julio is involved in farming, chicken raising, and construction. He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda. Julio is requesting a loan to buy manure, seed, fertilizer, and liquid supplies.

With the aid of the loan, he will enhance his family's economic situation. Julio's dream is to have  his own micro-market, plus other better activities, to generate earnings.

The challenges he confronts are seasonal drought and, at times, the winter. In his free time he enjoys festivals such as carnival.

Aided by the last loan, he was able to buy seed and manure. His family's situation has improved and production has increased to the family's benefit.

loans.use: buy manure, seed, fertilizer, and liquids for his crops.

loans.name: Gladys Janneth

texts.es:
Gladys Janneth tiene 22 años de edad es casada tiene 1 hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 1 año de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para tener un terreno propio. Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará la estabilidad económica de la familia.
El sueño es tener un  nuevo negocio. Los desafíos a los que ha diario se enfrenta es la sequedad o el invierno.
En los tiempos libres le gusta las festividades del día de la madre, año nuevo.
 
Con la ayuda del credito anterior pudço comprar los insumos, semillas, los ingresos han mejorado la relación familiar ha mejorado, la producción ha sido mejor u se pudo cultivar buen producto.
texts.en:
Gladys Janneth is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She lives with her husband and her one-year-old son in Guaranda, in Bolívar Province.

She is a member of the Communal Bank Ventanal which is located in the community of Guantuncoto, Julio Moreno Parish, canton of Guaranda, thirty minutes from the office. The community's inhabitants engage in a variety of activities including crop and livestock farming, animal husbandry (pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce and construction. 

Gladys devotes herself to farming. She makes her purchases and sales in Guaranda. She is seeking the loan in order to have her own plot of land. With the help of the loan her family's economic stability will improve. 

Her dream is to have a new business. The daily challenges she faces are drought or winter. In her free time she enjoys the holidays including Mother's Day and New Year's. 

With the help of the previous loan she was able to purchase supplies and seeds. Her income has improved, family relations have improved, production has gone up and she was was able to produce a good crop.

loans.use: to have her own own plot of land and improve her family's economic stability.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and they go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market. She has been in this business for 6 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested for a loan of 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy one bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are increasing prices of clothes and defaulters. Her goal and aspiration is to build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Francisca Ondina

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 50 años de edad, desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de verduras, su negocio está ubicado en el Mayoreo y gracias a este ha podido sostener a su familia. El negocio de venta de verduras es muy rentable ya que cuenta con muchos clientes y también tiene un puesto de ropa usada. 

Francisca está solicitando este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de fardos de ropa usada para mujeres, hombres y niños, ya que se aproxima la navidad y necesita surtir su negocio de nuevos estilos para así llamar la atención de las personas y así vender más. 

El mayor deseo de Francisca es aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar y tener un local propio y grande. Este es su tercer préstamo  en FAMA y es una clienta que ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Francisca, 50, has operated a vegetables sales business for 12 years.  The business is located in El Mayoreo and provides an important source of income for her family.  The business is profitable because she has a reliable stream of customers.  Francisca also sells used clothing.  

She is applying for this loan so that she can buy bulk supplies of used clothing--men's, women's and children's--to stock her business before Christmas.  Providing a wider range of merchandise will attract customers and, in turn, increase demand.

Francisca's goal is to increase her income and, in turn, improve her family's economic standing.  She wants to open a store where she can sell her merchandise.  This is her third FAMA loan and she has repaid past loans on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her used clothing business.

loans.name: Cristina Abigail

texts.es:
Cristina Abigail tiene 19 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo, suegros y el hijo de 8 meses de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.

Cristina se dedica a la Agricultura, crianza de animales. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en el arreglo de la casa.
El dinero del crédito lo utilizara muy bien. El sueño es tener un terreno. Lo9s desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es la sequedad del tiempo o mucho invierno.
En el tiempo libre le gusta las festividades del carnaval y el año nuevo.

cON LA AYUDA DEL CREDITO ANTERIOR pudo mejorar el estilo de vida y compro semillas, abonos agrícolas.los ingresos han mejorado, se ha cultivado productos de calidad, la relación con la familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Cristina Abigail, 19, is married and has one child.  She lives with her husband, her in-laws and her 8-month old son in Ecuador's Bolivar province. She is a member of the VENTANAL community bank in Guantuncoto, a town about 30 minutes from our office.  The people of the town operate businesses that include: farming, ranching, livestock-rearing (pigs, chickens, sheep), retailing and construction.  

Cristina makes a living from farming and livestock-rearing.  She buys and sells what she needs in Guaranda.  She is applying for a loan to make repairs to her house.  The money from the loan will be put to good use.  Cristina's goal is to own a place of her own.  She faces challenges such as drought and cold.  

In her free time, Cristina likes to go to Carnaval and New Year's festivals.

With the help of past loans, Cristina was able to improve her standard of living and buy seeds, fertilizer, etc.  Her income has increase, the quality of her crops has improved and her relations with her family are better.

loans.use: to pay for personal housing expenses.

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
María Beatriz tiene 25 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
María se dedica a la agricultura y quehaceres domésticos.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar  semillas, abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes, urea. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá tener una buena siembra y producción.
El sueño es  poder dar un mejor estudio a los hijos y poder construir una casa.
 Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades causales y en el negocio existe también competencia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
María Beatriz , 25, is married and has 2 children.  She lives with her husband and children--8- and 6-years old, respectively--in Ecuador's Bolivar province.
She is a member of the VENTANAL community bank in Guantuncoto, some 30 minutes from our office.  The people of the town make their livings from businesses that include: farming, ranching, livestock-rearing (pigs, chickens, sheep), retailing and construction.
Maria splits her time between a farming business and household chores.
She buys and sells what she needs in Guaranda.  She is applying for a loan to buy supplies for her farming business: seeds, manure, fertilizers, urea. 
With your help, she will be able to plant and harvest a good crop.
Her goals are to provide her children with a good education and build a house.
The challenges she faces include unexpected illnesses and competition from other farmers.
In her free time, Maria likes to join Carnaval celebrations.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase zinc and wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cement and sand.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Goreti lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 5 children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She sells green bananas at the market. She sells her product on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 4 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her matooke business into wholesale one. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Nong Taaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme Sylvie est la représentante du groupe NONG TAABA. Elle est  mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 7ans. Les 02 vont à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des habits depuis 04ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 01 douzaine de haut et des habits pour enfants.

Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille avec ses économies. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique d’habits et s’acheter une parcelle dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sylvie is the representative of NONG TAABA Group. She's married and the mother of two children. The oldest is 10 and the youngest is 7 years old. Both children attend school. She has two persons to support.

For four years, she's been selling clothing. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are women.

She would like to buy one dozen tops and children's clothing.

She would like to improve the standard of living of her family with her savings. In the future, she ambitions to open a clothing store and buy a land lot.

loans.use: to buy one dozen tops and children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer for her children's schooling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase medicine.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar Augusto tiene 48 años de edad es casado tiene 9 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 25, 20, 16, 14, 10, 8, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Cesar se dedica a la agricultura  siembra de papas, maíz, habas, trigo, cebada además se dedica a la  crianza de ganados, chanchos y ovejas.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para poder sembrar maíz y papas y comprar abonos agrícolas, semillas, fertilizantes, urea. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá cambiar la situación económica de la familia. El sueño es poder comparar un terreno y comprar un vehículo.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos, la lancha, enfermedades en los animales.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar los deportes como el bolí, futbol y las fiestas más tradicionales como el carnaval, San Pedro y los días de los difuntos.

con la ayuda del prestamo pudo comprar insumos, semillas, la relacuion familiar ha mejorado porque hubo una mejor producción, y los ingresos han mejorado.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto, 48, is married and has 2 children.  He lives with his wife and 9 children--25-, 20-, 16-, 14-, 10-, 8-, 6-, 4- and 2-years old, respectively--in Ecuador's Bolivar province.
He is a member of the VENTANAL community bank in Guantuncoto, some 30 minutes from our office.  The people of the town make their livings from businesses that include: farming, ranching, livestock-rearing (pigs, chickens, sheep), retailing and construction.
Cesar owns a farm.  He grows potatoes, maize, beans, wheat and barley.  He also raises cattle, pigs and sheep.
He buys and sells what she needs in Guaranda.  He is applying for a loan to buy supplies for his farming business: seeds, manure, fertilizers, urea. 
With your help, he will be able to better support his family.
His goals are to buy land and a vehicle.
The challenges he faces include plant and animal diseases.
In his free time, Cesar likes to play sports--boli and soccer, for example--and go to the celebrations for Carnaval, the festival of San Pedro, and Los Dias de los Difuntos [Days of the Dead].  

With help from past loans, Cesar was able to buy the supplies he needed for his farm.  His connection with his family has improved because of the extra income he's been able to earn.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase medicine.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto es un cliente distinguido que a lo largo  de sus  créditos  se  a  caracterizado por  tener  una excelente  cultura de pago y este es el segundo crédito que tiene con la institución, actualmente  se  dedica  a la  venta  de  frutas   lo  cual  le  a permitido  sacar  adelante  a su  familia,  es por ello  que  en esta  ocasión se acerco  con nosotros  para   realizar  la compra  de frutas ya  que  nos  comenta  que no  cuenta  con el  capital para  surtir  nuevamente   y poder  continuar  con la venta,  el Sr.  Roberto esta  muy  agradecido  por  el apoyo incondicional  que  a recibido  para  realizar  sus  proyectos.
texts.en: Roberto is a distinguished client who has exhibited excellent repayment behavior all along his credit history with the institution.  He currently sells fruit which has made it possible for him to support his family and this is why he approached us on this occasion: to buy fruit because he comments that he does not have capital to stock up again and continue selling.  Roberto is very grateful for the unconditional support he’s received to carry out his projects.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rihannata

texts.fr:
Mme Rihannata est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 35ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 10 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du charbon de bois depuis 8ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont ses voisins.

Mme veut s’acheter  18 sacs de charbon de bois.

Avec ses économies, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Mme ambitionne vendre en gros son charbon  (s’approvisionner en camion)et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rihannata is married and the mother of four. The eldest is 35 years of age, and the youngest is 20. No one is in school, and she has 10 dependents.
She has been selling charcoal for eight years. She stocks up in nearby villages. Her clients are her neighbors.  Rihannata would like to buy 18 bags of charcoal.

Thanks to her savings, she helps her husband cover the family expenses. Her goal is to  sell charcoal in balk (buying by truck load) and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 18 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Fatouimata

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Madame Fatoumata est âgée de 36 ans et vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans la  ville de Koutiala ( région de Sikasso ). 
Pour des raisons sociales, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer les études primaires elle s’est vite intéressée  aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis le bas âge auprès de sa mère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se lancer dans la vente des fruits et légumes il y a 10 ans. Fatoumata  trouve que cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, puisque les fruits et légumes sont des desserts qu’on a tous besoin pour le bien être.  
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle  en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 7 ans.  Après  13 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe)  tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 2eme prêt individuel dont le premier a été correctement payé.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter, des différents fruits et légumes à Sikasso et dans les villages environnants de Koutiala, elle effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle  de femmes et d’hommes  au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus. 
Elle compte sur les financements  de Soro  Yiriwaso pour l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Married with three children, Mrs. Fatoumata is 36 years old and lives with her ​​husband and their children in the town of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region).

For social reasons, she was not given the opportunity to continue primary school. She quickly became interested in income-generating activities she learned at her mother's side from early childhood.

After conducting several unsuccessful activities, she finally got involved in selling fruit and vegetables some 10 years ago. Fatoumata finds that this activity provides her with sufficient income, since fruit and vegetables are needed by all to stay healthy.

To satisfy her numerous customers and expand her business, she decided to approach of the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution seven years ago. After 13 solidarity loans (group loans) all correctly reimbursed, this is her second individual loan, the first having been repaid in full.

With this loan she intends to purchase various fruit and vegetables from Sikasso and from villages surrounding Koutiala. She sells retail at the general market in Koutiala to a base of women and men customers, for cash or credit.

She expects an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA she plans to use for Soro interest payments, participation in daily family expenses, and invest the remainder in other income-generating activities. She relies on funding from Soro Yiriwaso for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Armida

texts.es:
Rosa Armida tiene 25 años de edad es soltera tiene 4 hijos, vive con los hijos de 10, 8, 5 y 3 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura y avicultura. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para la siembra de maíz y arroz comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea. Con la ayuda del crédito el negocio mejorara y la familia estaría en mejores condiciones.
El sueño es poder tener casa propia, terreno  y que la familia los hijos culminen los estudios y sean profesionales.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los problemas económicos y la falta de dinero para comprar los químicos para la agricultura. En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval, finados, semana Santa y San Pedro.
 Con la ayuda del crédito anterior pudo comprar los insumos, semillas. La relación familiar ha mejorado, los ingresos también por el cultivo de los productos que se han podido vender a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Rosa Armida, 25, is single and has four children.  She lives with her children who are 10, 8, 5 and 3 years old in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.

She’s a member of the “Ventanal” communal bank which is formed in the community of Guantuncoto, Julio Moreno Canton, Guaranda, located 30 minutes away from the office.  Residents of the community carry out a variety of different activities like: farming, cattle raising, animal husbandry (pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce and construction.

Rosa is a farmer and raises barnyard fowl.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.  She’s asking for the loan for her corn and rice crops.  She’ll buy manure, fertilizer and urea.  With help from the loan the business will improve and her family will be in better condition.  Her dream is to own a house and farmland and that her children complete their education and become professionals.

The challenges she faces are economic problems and the lack of money to buy the chemicals needed for farming.  In her free time she enjoys the Carnival festivities, All Soul’s Day, Holy Week and the feast day of St. Peter.

With help from the last loan she was able to buy supplies and seeds.  Her family relationship has improved and so has income because she was able to sell her crops at a good price.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and urea.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
MARIAM est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit  avec son mari, sa coépouse et  leurs enfants  dans  la ville de Koutiala.  
Du à des problèmes de famille, MARIAM n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études,  raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis à bas âge qu’elle apprit auprès de sa maman.  
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle finit par opter pour l’achat et la vente de l’arachide depuis 20 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne, car elle reçoit des commandes important à travers les vendeurs de pâte d’arachide de Koutiala.   
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, MARIAM  a fait recours  à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 7 ans.   Elle a pris 13 prêts dans  une association (prêt solidaire) tous  remboursés correctement  et elle est à son deuxième  prêt individuel dont le précédent a été bien payer. 
Avec ce financement, elle compte acheter 15 sacs d’arachides  auprès des stokers de céréale de Koutiala  et elle effectue sa vente au grand marché à une clientèle  de femmes et d’hommes au comptant, en détail et à crédit.  Avec ce financement, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 110.000FCFA qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour le  remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.  
Dans ses perspectives, MARIAM compte élargir son activité dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Mariam is 54 years old, married with seven children. She lives with her ​​husband, her co-wife and their children in the town of Koutiala.

Due to family problems, Mariam did not have the opportunity to further her education. From an early age she focused on retail commerce, which she learned at her mother's side. 

After trying several income-generating activities, she eventually opted 20 years ago for the retail trade of groundnuts (peanuts). Her reputation is good, as she receives large orders from Koutiaba-based sellers of groundnut paste.

To increase her working capital and expand her business, Mariam approached the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution some seven years ago. As member of an association she was granted 13 group loans, all correctly repaid. She is now ready to receive a second individual loan, the previous one having been fully reimbursed.

With this funding, she plans to purchase 15 bags of groundnuts from Koutiala grain wholesalers. She will then sell retail at the great market to a clientele of women and men, for cash or credit.

She expects this funding will generate monthly profits of 110.000 FCFA she intends to use to reimburse Soro loan interests and contribute to improve her family's living conditions.

Looking to the future, Mariam plans to diversify her business activity.

loans.use: Buy bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Daniel Alexander

texts.es:
Daniel Alexander tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el papá y la mamá  en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Daniel se dedica a la agricultura deseando obtener un mejor producto. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para obtener una mejor agricultura, compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá tener un mejor estilo de vida. Los desafíos que se le ha presentado es la falta de dinero para comprar los insumos y abonos. En el tiempo libre le gusta las festividades del carnaval y semana santa.


Con la ayuda del crédito anterior pudo comprar semillas, abonos agrícolas. La relación familiar ha mejorado con el producto cosechado que se pudo vender a un buen precio que es favorable para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Daniel Alexander, 19, is single and has no children.  He lives with his mother and father in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.

He is a member of the “Ventanal” communal bank which is formed in the community of Guantuncoto in Julio Moreno Canton, Guaranda, 30 minutes away from the office.  The residents of this community carry out a variety of activities like: farming, cattle raising, animal husbandry (pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce and construction.

Daniel is a farmer wanting to obtain a better product.  His purchases and sales take place in Guaranda.  He requests the loan to improve his crops.  He will buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and urea.

With help from the loan he will be able to have a better standard of living.  The challenge he’s faced has been the lack of money to buy supplies and manure.  In his spare time he enjoys the festivities of Carnival and Holy Week.

With help from the previous loan he was able to buy seeds and farming manure.  His family relationship has improved because he was able to sell his harvested goods for a good price which benefitted the family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and urea.

loans.name: Oseas Neftali

texts.es:
Óseas vive rodeado de  familiares, se dedica a la venta de francés y dulce, trabaja todos los días de la semana elaborando el pan y ofreciendo a los clientes, su trabajo inicia a las cuatro de la mañana y finaliza a las dos de la tarde.
Actualmente él solicitó un préstamo para invertirlo en harina, manteca, azúcar y leña, con estos productos podrá mantener la panadería, comparando al por mayor y recibiendo un mejor precio de sus proveedores.
La aspiración de óseas es convertirse en una persona servicial a la sociedad, creciendo su panadería y ofreciendo una fuente de empleo a jóvenes de la zona.
texts.en:
Óseas lives surrounded by relatives. He is engaged in the sale of French bread and sweet rolls. He works every day of the week making bread and offering it to his customers. His work begins at 4:00 in the morning and ends at 2:00 in the afternoon.

Currently, he is applying for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of flour, lard, sugar and firewood. With these products he will be able to maintain the bakery, purchasing them at wholesale and receiving a better price from his suppliers. Óseas’ goal is to become a person useful to society, enlarging his bakery and offering a source of employment to young people in the area.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, lard, sugar, and firewood.

loans.name: Wilmer Efrain

texts.es:
Wilmer Efraín tiene 20 años de edad es casado tiene 1 hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de 4 meses de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura, construcción, empleados locales. Las compra  y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para mejorar la calidad de vida en el hogar, comprar semillas, fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.
Wilmer espera obtener buena producción manejando y administrando bien el dinero del crédito. El sueño es poder tener casa y carro propio.
 Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es el clima, mucho invierno y en veces mucho verano.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval, día de la Madre.
texts.en:
Wilmer Efraín is 20 years old. He is married and has 1 child. He lives with his wife and with the 4 month old baby, in Guaranda Province of Bolivar.

The member is a member of the VRC Ventana which can be found in the community of Guantuncoto, in the parish of Julio Moreno which is in the canton of Guaranda, a distance of 30 minutes from the office. The residents of the community work in different fields such as agriculture, farming, breeding of animals (pigs, chickens, sheep), sales and construction.

Wilmer works in agriculture and in construction, locally employed. Buying and selling takes place in Guaranda. He is asking for a loan in order to improve his quality of life at home, buying seeds, fertilizers, supplies and compost. 

Wilmer is expecting to have a good crop, handling and administrating capably the money from the loan. His dream is to be able to have his own house and car.

The challenges that he has encountered is the weather, a long winter or sometimes too much summer. 

In his free time he enjoys the festivities of Carnival and Mother’s Day.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, supplies and compost in order to improve his quality of life at home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a television set.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy iron, cement and sand.

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario,  tiene un pequeño negocio de venta  de  ropa , de la  cual se ayuda para salir adelante con su familia que  es lo mas importante  en su  vida, este negocio  le  a permitido brindar a  sus  hijos  una  buena estabilidad  económica, en esta  ocasión ella  requiere  realizar  la compra de  ropa para continuar  con su proyecto, ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  incrementar  sus  ingresos además  de que  podrá  seguir  ofreciéndoles a  sus  clientes   un  excelente   servicio.
texts.en: Rosario has a small business selling clothes which helps her support her family which is the most important thing in her life.  This business has allowed her to provide her children with good economic stability.  On this occasion, she needs to buy clothes to continue with her project.  She sees in the loan the opportunity to increase income in addition to being able to continue offering her customers excellent service.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Mme Hélène est  mariée  et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé  a 15ans et  le moins âgé a 10ans. Les  02 vont   à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend des chaussures depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont  les femmes du quartier.

Elle veut  s’acheter  100 chaussures.

 Mme utilise  ses bénéfices pour améliorer son activité. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir une boutique pour son affaire.
texts.en:
Hélène is married and mother to two children. The eldest is 15 years old and the youngest 10. They both go to school. Héène has four people in her care.

She has been selling shoes for the past five years and gets her supplies from the Sector 10 market. Her customers are women from the neighborhood. 

Hélène would like to buy 100 shoes. She uses the profits she makes to improve her business and her ambition is to open a shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy 100 shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, es comerciante de ropa nueva y chancletas, tiene casa propia, vive con su hijo, es madre soltera, ella inicio su negocio de venta de ropa con una amiga, luego tuvo experiencia en el manejo de los precios y logro instalar su propio negocio, las ventas las realiza en las zonas cercanas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, short, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, y también un pedido de chancletas para damas, caballeros y niños, esta compra le permitirá ofrecer una nueva variedad de mercadería.
Su aspiración es crecer en su negocio, teniendo más experiencia y generando más ganancias para su hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia is a new clothes and sandal merchant.  She owns her house and lives with her son; she’s a single mother.  She started selling clothes with a girlfriend and acquired experience managing prices and managed to open her own business.  Her sales take place in nearby areas.

She is asking for the present loan to buy clothes like shorts, skirts, dresses and underwear and also for an order of women’s, men’s and children’s sandals.  This purchase will make it possible for her to offer a new variety of merchandise.  Her hope is to stay in business acquiring more experience and generating more profits for her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Dignora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dignora, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella sale a vender de forma ambulante, desde hace 12 años realiza este negocio, vende en los lugares cercanos donde tiene clientes, este negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un ingreso para la familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad para su clientela, ofreciéndoles nuevos estilos para satisfacer la demanda.
La aspiración de Dignora es mejorar su negocio a través de las inversiones y con la ayuda de los préstamos, además ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Dignora is a clothes merchant.  She lives with her husband and two children.  She goes out selling from place to place and has been in business for 12 years.  She sells in nearby areas where she has customers.  The business arose from the need to have income for her family.

She is asking for a new loan to buy underwear for women and men.  This investment will help her have better availability for her customers offering new styles to meet demand.  Dignora’s hope is to improve her business through investments and with help from the loans in addition to helping her children with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy underwear for women and men.

loans.name: Twibumbirehamwe Rgrgr Group

texts.fr:
Marie  fait partie du groupe Twibumbirehamwe/Rgrgr. Elle a 30 ans et elle est mariée avec 5 enfants de 2 à 13 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Marie est cultivatrice de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Marie voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie, age 30, is a member of Twibumbirehamwe/Rgrgr Group. She has five children, age 2 to 13. Out of them, two attend school. Her own level of education amounts to six years of elementary school.

Marie is a rice cultivator. She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. She will use it to buy chemical fertilizers.

Her strategy for growing her business is to expand her rice cultivation area. In the forthcoming years, she would like to be the rice provider in his region.

She intends to use her profits to educate her children and send them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Lazaro Alberto

texts.es:
Lázaro, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, él se dedica a compra de cerdos y venta de carne, también hace canastas artesanales el destazo lo atiende los sábados desde las tres de la mañana, las canastas las prepara en sus momentos libres para venderlas a los vecinos o en el mercado.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar cerdos para el destazo, también comprara más materiales para preparar las canastas, éste inversión de ayudar a para mejorar sus dos negocios y poder tener el dinero necesario para realizar las compras necesarias.
Su aspiración es seguir creciendo trabajando de la mano con préstamos con la esperanza de mejorar futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lázaro lives with his wife and two children who are 8 and 3 years old.  He buys pigs and sells meat.  He also makes artisanal baskets.  He tends to the butchering on Saturdays starting at 3am and makes the baskets in his free time to sell to neighbors or in the market.

He requests a loan to buy pigs to butcher and also to buy the supplies to make the baskets.  This investment will help him improve both businesses and to have the money needed for his necessary purchases.  His aim is to continue growing in work alongside the loans with the hope of improving his children’s future.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Cosme Damian

texts.es: El Sr. Cosme es una persona  muy trabajadora  que  se  preocupa  por  brindarle   una buena estabilidad  a su  esposa e  hijos,  el  se acerco  con  nosotros  ya  que  desea  adquirir  una  casa por  medio de  Infonavit  pero  en este  momento  no  cuenta con la cantidad que  le requiere  para   el  otorgamiento  de al  vivienda, agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para   hacer  su  sueño  realidad  el cual  le  permitirá dejar  un  patrimonio a  su  familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Cosme is a hardworking individual who is concerned about providing stability for his wife and children. He approached Credituyo because he wants to acquire a house through the INFONAVIT (government housing subsidy) program, but at the moment he does not have the amount for the down payment that is required to obtain a home.

He appreciates the support provided in order to make his dream a reality so that he can leave an inheritance for his family.

loans.use: to cover the down payment toward the purchase of a home.

loans.name: Fabrice

texts.fr:
Client de 34 ans, celibataire avec un enfant de 6 ans, ayant fini ses etudes universitaires,et ne trouvant pas du travail dans la fonction publique, il se lance dans le commerce des tissus il ya de cela 8 ans. 
Ces successifs  prêts lui ont apportes un grand secours dans son activité, il a renforce son capital, ses épargnes sont considérables et a fait des remboursements sans défauts de paiements
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renouveler le stock de ses marchandises, surtout qu'a la veille des fêtes de fin d'année, il va acheter des tissus de qualité comme le satin, la soie, des dentelles, les tissus de cérémonies des super 100, 150 .
Il a des stratégies très efficace, il vend ses tissus chez les grands couturiers de la place, des femmes des mutuelles et associations , des maries et parfois il fait la vente dans les bureaux et va de maison en maison.

Tres entreprenant, il tient  a ouvrir une grande boutique des tissus de qualité et s' occupe valablement de son enfant.
texts.en: This borrower is 34 years old, single, and has a 6-year-old child.
